8fXRLmQ_SkNYfr4jRjiKGg.text: Holler and dash was pretty good My boyfriend and I went for a date he had the chicken set go biscuit and I had to Hollaback chicken biscuit is pretty good I would definitely go back again it's very clean the line wasn't very long the tots are good as well ...

6Q8C4QLXdzRMXTpFP6CNbA.text: This place was alright. My husband got the pork and Blackberry biscuit breakfast. It was a delicious, southern classic of salt, cholesterol and oil. But let's be honest you dont come to a place like this for healthy. Unfortunately I was dumb enough to and ordered one of their bowls. My cashier had a very hard time with the fact that I didn't want dressing on it. I couldn't add avocado... why? The greens were shriveled and yellow. The pickled onion and sweet potato just tasted like cold salt, and the charred corn is actually a little corn medley drowning in mayo. W3ayVUF7Mg6mxzwXHEcnDw.text: Great southern food. Excellent service here and a nice variety on the menu. Highly recommend!

BiQs1BhaPwN0elElUIv32w.text: I was very disappointed in Holler & Dash service today. I ordered a grit bowl at 11:58 am, over 20 minutes in waiting for my order, I approached an employee regarding my order. Around, 12:30 pm, I received my grit bowl in a small styrofoam container. I'm not sure why the employee placed hot grits in a styrofoam container because the grits leaked through the container. Typically, the grit bowl is packaged in a large plastic microwave safe plate with a cover; however,  today in came in the same packaging as a biscuit sandwich. I've received subpar service today. I couldn't enjoy my meal with half of the grits leaking out of the soggy container.  I did not receive an apology or explanation for waiting 30 minutes for a grit bowl.  I'm not sure if the supervisor took the day off but there was clearly no order in the kitchen today.

8rWUTnPYZsqY4x0_fb-HOg.text: Sooo good!  Chicken. Set. Go. Wonderful food, GREAT service!!!  My new favorite place. You've got to come!

yiomSYl1MKBJOxQPZbBJHQ.text: It's a chain, but doesn't feel like one. Unique biscuit recipes with traditional southern flavors coming through. Loved the chicken/pimento cheese one.

9p3n3h2srumAt5VMohXcVg.text: This place is trying too hard - blackberry butter?! I ordered a pork chop biscuit. It would've been great BUT, they slathered it in blackberry butter - I've never tasted something so GROSS in my life! My god - why take something great and ruin it! Who needs to change the amazing flavor of butter? You guys are trying to re-invent the wheel - the wheel works fine without blackberry butter. Um, I would like to add that the customer service was great they replaced my biscuit with a plain one and it was delicious.

P5dYraNtmBTedfs3BywrEg.text: We visited Saturday morning because I was looking for a fun breakfast adventure for the family and a couple reviewers had given it high marks compared to Maple Street in Jacksonville and Biscuit Love in Nashville. There was a little bit of a line, but it moved quickly. Food came out fast and fresh. I ordered the gravy biscuit and it was awesome! Just the right amount of heat and a great amount of sausage in the gravy. One kid had the Strawberries and Dash which I thought was great and but he didn't care of the cream cheese. My other son had the beignets. He loved because of all the powdered sugar, but I was not a fan. Sadly, they were more like biting into a piece of styrofoam. My husband had the Kickback Chicken and it was pretty awesome. He was hoping to find something on the menu similar to the Sticky Maple at Maple Street so he was a little disappointed, but the Kickback was still great. We also got the tots and cheese grits for sides. They were pretty standard. We were disappointed in the coffee. Nothing spectacular, generic regular and decaf, however I did think it was nice they had almond milk and stevia. Would like to see a flavored option or some kind of a house made syrup added to the coffee bar. All other items really had special components ubiquity to the restaurant except this one. They do offer espresso drinks, but we didn't try. Overall, I would come back if in the area, but this would rank number 3 behind Maple Street and Biscuit Love.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States

2qpiX3grHBDfNGjWzLyNWQ.text: Food is incredible! I highly recommend the chicken biscuit with pimento cheese, jalapeno and honey. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful!

t2fMp9WT5HVk4ifxu0-UYQ.text: Stopped in after the know your craft 5k Saturday. It was busy but the line was not that long. I ordered a chicken biscuit with medium sauce. It was delicious. To go I ordered the smoked turkey club and potato salad. All the items were delicious. Service was quick and easy. I will definitely be returning to try more of their menu items.

wF4hf_dFUe7xbnIohBYLfw.text: Was super excited to try this place. It was pretty busy but the wait wasn't that long. The choices are a little different but they do have some plain options as well.  They are a little pricey but the biscuits are pretty large. So large that I could not bite both sides of the biscuit. The sausage egg and cheese was tasty. The jelly that they have, raspberry, really  completed the meal. The side of tots are a shareable size and come with a zesty sauce. It was pretty good. My sister's biscuit was undercooked and doughy, she was pretty disappointed. I've received reports that the grits are good. Overall, the food was good but not as good as I anticipated.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States

v3w89wcrSulMaoD_nX3bBg.text: In town and was looking for a good breakfast place. Found this on Yelp (of course). It was ok. It is clean and trendy although one of the bathrooms didn't have tp My boyfriend had the chicken Hollar biscuit. He liked it but he couldn't had two-that says more about him than the dish tho lol) I had the avocado toast which I must say was really really good. But this dish they claim to be an omelet was really sad and expensive considering what you get. It was tasty enough but I just wouldn't call it an omelet and wouldn't pay $9.50. For it. It's got that chain restaurant feel to it. It didn't help that we had just went to an amazing biscuit place in Charleston yesterday (Viscous Biscuits).

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Avocado toast
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hollar biscuit. Boyfriend liked it.
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sad sad &#34;omelet&#34;. Tasty but not worth the price.

IHMVajNWqqfCJEtSplmTwA.text: I had the grits bowl. Hot grits, egg, bacon, green onion and hot sauce. It was delicious! The food came out fast and the amenities were very clean.

Nk5o1S3pXI6ij4MoH9s-Bg.text: I've been waiting to eat here since noticing the unusual name of the restaurant trying to guess what type of food was on the menu.  Well, I was totally surprised at the fare served here; a hip southern biscuits combinations with a twist & waves of Flavor breakfast & brunch spot.  Can you say Holler for another biscuit sandwich please and make a Dash to come back tomorrow 'cause they close at 2pm.    I ordered the kickback chicken biscuit w/a side of of cheddar grits..yummy delicious, fast, friendly, excellent service from stepping foot in the door, enjoying every bite of food and drink to exiting.   Rosie B.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States

90q_1iPj-a5_sySguHsqGw.text: Holler & Dash is a new favorite of mine. I went for Sunday brunch. Parking is a bit difficult so I would suggest walking or biking. The line was about 10-15 minutes long. But after sitting down our food was out in 5 minutes! I had the Chicken Set Go, a biscuit with pimento cheese and chicken, and it was amazing. At first I thought the portion was small but I was stuffed by the end. I also ordered cheese grits and they were very yummy but also a small proportion.  Inside is decorated really well. Every person working there was so fun and friendly. Really enjoyed it and will be back.

hRGjYE3tFWKpJd4HCipwpQ.text: Pretty much a loss in my books.  Yeah, I'm gluten free and went to a biscuit house. Maybe that was my first  mistake but being owned by Cracker Barrel who has, actually a HUGE gluten free menu with lots of options, I thought this place would have the same.  Nope.  They don't even serve egg whites. I ended up with some sort of brussel sprout salad.  J's biscuit was fine he said but wasn't a huge fan.  The quick casual service was fast and everyone was friendly, so I can't really ding them all the way down. Coffee was good, too! Just won't be running back for multiple reasons.

SZFKPClwk_MTkLl3qdT4xQ.text: LOVED this place. I'm honestly hollering at myself for not trying it sooner.   The staff was very friendly and super helpful for our first visit. Despite how busy it was, they did not hurry us along. We went on a rainy Saturday around 11am and the line was to the door, but moved quickly. We were also able to find a nice table for the three of us- fast turnover.    We tried a little bit of everything and it was all delicious.. even the coffee was really good. I'm already thinking about what I'll try next time!

mlGj0Xr8yWDF6VjNMNQgdw.text: The classics are delicious and the prices are great. Adding a side makes for the perfect amount of food for brunch. The atmosphere of the place is great, but you're fairly close to other people given its somewhat smaller. The parking is shared with many other businesses and a Harris Teeter so it can be tough to find a parking space - especially on a Saturday morning.  Overall a great brunch spot!

YUUdTsIhaXsncN6EWuWveQ.text: Awesome breakfast place!  I have eaten there for about three Saturdays in a row and haven't been disappointed yet.  They hit all the notes...  Sweet tea,  Banging hot sauce ( hot)  And cheese grits that stand up to any southerners mommas,  just saying!!!

BRAHDDGjg3mBVfVtXx_5KQ.text: Quite possibly the tastiest biscuit I have ever had. . . and my physique can affirm that I've had my fair share of biscuits.  The biscuits are crisp on the outside and soft, flaky, and lush underneath.   My advice: order a  biscuit sandwich and eat it open-faced. Then,  drizzle honey on the biscuit top and enjoy it again. Twice the biscuit pleasure. I got the bacon egg and cheese biscuit and cheddar and bacon were melted on the bottom half of my biscuit and topped with a freshly fried egg. So good.

pG_qV8Ur_sunNjYGGO_5vw.text: Charlotte has been lacking a biscuit joint, and Holler & Dash is just what the doctor ordered! The line on a Saturday morning around 10 was 25 people deep, but it moved along quickly. They have plenty of seating inside and a decent size patio with about 10 tables. Since my husband and I walked with our dog we got a patio seat. Upon being seated, one of the employees brought our dog a fresh water bowl. In addition the manager (I believe) came out with a custom Holler & Dash dog biscuit! From that moment on I knew this would be my new breakfast joint!   Our food was brought out to us in under 10 minutes. Nice and made to order. I also started with a coffee, which is brewed locally. Love that!   I decided to go with the kickback chicken biscuit with a side of tots. My biscuit was amazing! The chicken was lightly breaded and had a nice peppery kick to it. The biscuit was soft and the goat cheese paired with the sweet pepper jam was a great combo!!! I even dipped some of my tots in the jam that dropped off my biscuit and it was dynamite. Definitely getting an extra side of it next time! And for $9.5 I left happy and satisfied!! My husband got the hot chicken pimento cheese biscuit, which he really enjoyed - but it didn't compare to mine in my opinion.   Overall great experience at H&D and I can't wait to go back!!!

WmmHAG5L3oD8sUVKloT3kw.text: Good biscuits. Had the the Kicken Chicken. Great combo of flavors. Long lines, moved quickly. Had a person at the door greeting you. She also was available for questions. I found her very helpful. Hubby had the biscuits and gravy. He raved about the gravy. He also had the smashed avocado toast. He said he should of had it on sourdough. The front house staff was very helpful. I'm coming back to try the roast beef sandwich, it looked so good!

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States

IWD624c0rC_doUtmt_FeoQ.text: Great food. Lots of drink choices. Cool atmosphere. Small space but cute. I would definitely recommend the Mary's Muffin....to die for. I added a meat which made it even better.

7e8lz9ZqNwCYJnewYqcI7A.text: Great breakfast. Tried 3 or 4 different things and they have all been terrific. The coffee is very good. Can get busy but always seems to move pretty quick.

FwfqCEEO4mpKArSeyBSvlw.text: Updating my original review from one year ago.   I went for breakfast today which happens to be my second time coming here. My original review for the grits are the same. They look like they might be good but they are still CRUNCHY. Those are the worst type of grits! Don't get them and thank me later.   I got three garden biscuit again just like last time. It was still really good but the biscuit size is smaller then last time we went. My hubby said the same thing about his kickback chicken biscuit. The biscuit size is smaller.   What is also smaller are the sides. They use to come in a bowl and now it's a small ass plastic cup thing. The sides are so underwhelming.  Idk if it's worth the $9 for a biscuit when the sides are small as hell and not anything good to pick up.   I guess I would go with the tater tots again but meh.   Another complaint I have are the employees in the kitchen constantly leaving the kitchen to get their personal drinks from where the patrons get their drinks from. So unprofessional. They also are loud.   Yeah don't think I'll be back. They need to make some changes.

wMXa0QnMUJTTiJwLh_Pqwg.text: Good biscuits, better sandwiches.  This an excellent restaurant concept. Patrons can enjoy free coffee, the service is super fast and friendly, and most importantly the menu is great. The biscuits are nicely done and the selection of biscuit-sandwiches is great. Super good combinations.   I went the opposite direction, since H&D is known for its biscuits, and opted for a sandwich. I was not disappointed. I got the Raise Up Roast Beef and honestly it might be the best roast beef sandwich I've ever had. I chose the potato salad as a side and it was amazing as well. It's not TOO southern-ish (i.e. loaded with more mayo than one's heart can handle).   Alcohol isn't served here, but that's okay. All that means is the customer turnover rate is pretty quick. With a fresh take on some classics, Holler and Dash is a great fast and casual spot for breakfast or lunch.

UqUDzRTiMHFMuDMnceD1Tg.text: Holler & Dash definitely lives up to the hype. I love that this place is fast casual yet dishes out some very atypical options that are delicious. The quality and taste for the price point can't really be beat for brunch. I had the Chicken.Set.Go. and my mom had the Hollerback Club. The food came out fast but was fresh. We both absolutely loved our dishes. Their fried chicken is on point. They have nitro coffee if you like a good cold brew. The portion size left me full and I skipped lunch. Great customer service as well and the tables were clean.

fE5Qoe1GKo_QYHYdspfEFg.text: Get the beignets! Get them! I couldn't post a picture because I ate them too fast but they come with a delicious mocha coffee sauce and they're amazing. If you go on a weekend morning be prepared to wait in line for at least 30 minutes but once you order they are quick to get your food out.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kickback chicken biscuit &amp; cold brew

tNAF3LAnAab29YRntx36bw.text: Believe the hype! Fresh, moist,large biscuits are spectacular! The service is great! A greeter meets you at the door with a menu to either seat you or bring you your online order. There's patio seating which is also dog-friendly. The Kickback chicken sandwich is really good. It satisfies both sweet and savory pallets. The Chicken Set Go sandwich is good as well. This is the one to get if you like pimento cheese.  Parking is adequate. Be aware that they close at 2pm. Weekends can be quite busy for them so order online if your short on time!

aXTT4J5CDt2QUluxTae0qA.text: This is the third time I've been here and it's good every time! I ordered the bacon, egg, and cheese biscuit with a side of cheese grits. I fell in love with the thick cut bacon especially with the homemade raspberry jelly. It was so good. The staff was pleasant and all smiling. They stopped by our table to make sure we were good. I'll be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States

3EpsydiBri4JBzBq5eORrQ.text: Disappointed with our breakfast today. The omelet had pockets of extreme saltiness.  The asparagus was shaved raw; interesting but not the best, they would have improved with a little marinating.  The not-even-close-to-roasted cherry tomatoes were ice cold, making them off putting.  The tots bowl had cheese in a big solid clump.  The beignets were the worst, completely soaked through with oil.  When we asked for an egg fried medium, they said they only fry eggs hard (?!).  Nice decor but how can this place survive on the food?  Better to try a biscuit, but too many negatives to return.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Oil-soaked beignet.  Ugh!

YB6K51ycIw7V6OMx2LOMmw.text: Legit biscuits!!! This place is so simple but everything they do is top notch. It is a walk up and order restaurant. Place your order then find a seat. They have both indoor and outdoor seating. Place your # in one of the holes on the table and wait for your little slice of biscuit heaven, I mean food, to be delivered to your table. 4 of us each ordered something different, from the beignets to the kickback chicken to the biscuits and gravy. Everything was amazing, literally, and it is super friendly for kids.   Reminder, there are menu's that provide more options than just the overhead board.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Amazing all around!!

Fpm7UJjQpHUdZTH06DqwTA.text: When I think of good southern food, this is the perfect semi fast food semi diner place I would recommend.  Kickback Chicken-5/5. The pepper jelly on fried chicken? Amazing idea. The biscuit is so flaky, buttery, soft yet doesn't fall apart. Tots- standard tator tots but love that they serve it instead of standard french fries. Beignets-3/5. Nothing compared to NOLA, but nice that they attempt it. Comes with a delicious COFFEE CHOCOLATE DIPPING SAUCE!  Easy menu, fast service, clean dining area. Highly recommend for a quick bite thats not junk.

F-zdfHH50epwKykQRNRfgw.text: Aggressively average food for a place as hyped up as this. The scrambled eggs and sausage could've come straight from a hotel continental breakfast. It took 30 minutes to get my latte, which was handed to me in a to-go cup as I walked out the door. The biscuits were the only redeemable and above average part of the meal. I probably will not be returning, as there are plenty of far better breakfast places in Charlotte for about the same price.

fXqQcX1vrWxnhierCAuj4g.text: Really yummy biscuits sandwiches. It's more of casual fast restaurant than a brunch place

2Ghx6Rkw4ewPYutx6wLwaQ.text: With food this good, it's easy to see where the name comes from. Food so good it makes you wanna holler. Ok pretty sure that's not where it came from, but it's a cool story and I'm sticking to it.   When your specialty is biscuits, you better make a damn good biscuit. Holler and Dash serves a wonderfully flaky, buttery, warm biscuits with pretty much anything you can think of sandwiched in between.   Chicken biscuits, pork, eggs, bacon,strawberry's, jam, and many many more. Sure there's sandwiches and bowls, but who comes here and doesn't get a biscuit?! Don't be that person.   The HOLLERBACK CLUB is Devine! Bacon, guacamole, fried green tomato, and hollerback sauce. The fried green tomatoes themselves are worth every penny of this masterpiece.   To top it all off, you'd be hard pressed finding anything over $10 on the menu. I really do envy the south sometimes. Actually, at the expense of my health, it's better this way.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States

XvYMBqEUg0uRW28C3IjK8g.text: I usually get a grit bowl, but today I tried the Chicken Set Go. It was amazing! The combination sounds weird but altogether is really good. The honey cools down the spice of the jalapeno so it's just a kick. I would get this again!

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken. Set. Go

7TuhEdGoXuqx_ieZ4hPIMw.text: This is my go to breakfast spot on the weekends! The only bad thing is the parking- between the grocery store and other nearby businesses it's always packed and hard to find spots- however, ordering ahead and picking up is what I recommend doing. The Kickback Chicken is hands down one of the best biscuits I've ever had! Who knew putting goat cheese and pepper jelly on a biscuit would be so good?! I will definitely be back again soon! Thanks for bringing your biscuits to the Southend area Holler and Dash!

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kickback Chicken Biscuit

haPoJzfM_ltFR5Uchg2kEA.text: Probably won't be back. It wasn't that the food didn't taste good. It just didn't agree with our stomachs afterwards.   Tots- the best  Grits- yummy, but too much.   Fried green tomatoes- ok, not the best  Egg and cheese biscuit- 6 out of 10. My friend said her stomach was unhappy also.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheese grits- good but too much for a side
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tots were awesome!! Sauce was not good
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried green tomatoes- not great, ok. Sauce was gross

kOYNBtr_MQudzS82wVg3aA.text: Was looking for something unique for breakfast on my way home from work and decided to try Holler & Dash.  Everything on their menu sounded so good and nothing like your typical breakfast joint.  I was having a hard time choosing between all the amazing items on the menu.  With the help of the person at the register (who may be my new best friend), I went with the Kickback Chicken biscuit.  It was so delicious.  The different flavors went so well together.  Fried chicken breast, goat cheese and pepper jelly on a biscuit, wow!  I am only in town a little longer, but will definitely stop in again before I leave.

rQxGNi0tgkIZQarUmDRxFA.text: This had been on my list for so long before I finally made it there. It completely lived up to expectations!  We went on a Saturday morning and there was no line. We got the Chicken Set Go and the Kickback Chicken. Both were absolutely amazing! I may have liked the Kickback Chicken slightly more, but it's hard to pick. For sides we got the charred corn salad and the cheddar grits. Both were good.   We went all out and got the Strawberry & Dash and The Jam for dessert. I didn't try The Jam, but my husband loved it. The Strawberry & Dash was great.   We got our food very fast and the service was very friendly.   I highly recommend coming here! I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Strawberries and cream
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kickback chicken
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken set go

TxqChDS7-QBFt3k-0RbjBw.text: Nothing to rave about. This place is just not that special. I ordered the chicken holler biscuit. I specifically asked for no cheese. I guess they didn't hear me because it was loaded with cheddar cheese. After I told them I said "no cheese" the girl misheard me again and gave me goat cheese. I'm like why don't you just repeat my order back to me so we are both on the same page? Had to wait for another 5 mins for a cold chicken biscuit. They also left out my pickles. The biscuit was good but the side was served in these sample cups, enough to feed an ant.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States

w5v_TwtHEUv0_e48_7Sf5g.text: Let me start this review off by saying I am the person going to a biscuit house and didn't order the biscuits. I wanted to because the fried chicken there looks and smells amazing. I'm on a strict diet and can't have fried food or carbs. So I was excited for the bowl options. I ordered the Every Day I'm Brussel'n and had to resist singing as I ordered. I added rotisserie chicken to mine.   The salad looked beautiful as did my coworkers plates. The salad was uncooked finely shredded brussel sprouts, apple and parmesan, I think. The dressing complimented the salad well and I could have used more of it. The chicken was very dry. I was expecting a tender juicy piece of chicken and, instead got some rock hard strips of chicken. So it's not something I want to order again.   Staff was very friendly and the restaurant itself was very clean. They also have a Coke Freestyle machine, which is a plus since it has many choices I can drink like sparkling water.  Overall, I didn't see what the hype was about.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Every Day I&#39;m Brussel&#39;n!

qswsskQms5Q3Ej-2JjEQ7A.text: Great spot for a good breakfast! I have to admit it didn't have the biscuit but I did have the grit bowl which I highly suggest. The grits had cheddar cheese in them and came with a fried egg and green onions.  The lines can be long and you order at the counter and the bring the food too you at your table. They don't sale mimosas for those who love mimosas with their brunch or breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States

4SEbnbL4vbRJpYS4w7CV0g.text: They are located in the same parking lot as the new Harris Teeter in Southend, right beside Nekter Juice Bar.  I arrived early morning before work, and I already knew what I wanted and thankfully it was not crowded.   The staff wasn't very friendly but I was in a hurry to get in and out before the crowd got there.  I ordered the beignets, and the grit bowl minus the eggs as they didn't offer egg whites.  It wasn't a very long wait before they were bringing my bag to me.  Everything looked great, the beignets had lots of powder and were pretty good but the coffee dipping sauce that comes with it was a no for me, it started off ok and kind of like chocolate but then the coffee taste and bite takes over.  The grit bowl was really good kind of creamy and good flavoring.  I'm not really big on biscuits so maybe I'll try them at some point.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grit bowl
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beignets

H6f1mwzSJISxb5DxErA-6A.text: Went here for a quick bite. Great tasting food. We ordered the kickback chicken and goat cheese sandwich (?) Kickback chicken is the way to go. Great amount of chicken: biscuit : toppings. Ratio. I enjoyed the sweet n spicy jelly on the sandwich. Goat cheese just the right amount.  Goat cheese sandwich (?) too much goat cheese for one sandwich. Wouldn't order again.   2nd visit kickback chicken and beignets.  Same great sandwich... glad I can count on the consistency.  Beignets = disappointment to the name sake. Won't order again. Should be light and airy. They were dense, chewy, dry with powered sugar dropped on top.  Tator tots = normal sauce that comes with makes them great  Potato salad - different but not tasty enough for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kickback chicken sandwich w/ tator tots Garden goat cheese sandwich w/ potato salad
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kickback chicken w/ tator tots.  Garden goat w/ potato salad

EV8JSX3x8NP9jCCKOK6XXQ.text: Decent breakfast spot. Food was done in like 5 minutes. I got a BEC biscuit and a side of cheesy grits. Not bad for 8 dollars. I got lucky by not standing in a long line that goes out the door. This place seems very popular on the weekends. Good alternative to waiter service.

sbM-8rIKvcnF5MgyCfNvyA.text: I received great service. The food was tasty and quickly prepared. I wish there were more healthy options but if I'm on a cheat day this was definitely savory and filling.

rADlwBs-4k2X4nwk67h_LA.text: Pretty good quick service restaurant for breakfast. The biscuits were pretty good. I ordered the sausage egg and cheese biscuit.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sausage egg and cheese biscuit

QmSEYVJp326gjPsKrsPWrQ.text: My mom's omelette was pathetic. It looked like it came right out from a complimentary breakfast at a hotel, definitely not worth the $9.50. We were really disappointed because we had high expectations after reading all the raving reviews about them. I didn't think it was possible for an omelette to look so poorly made.  Even though everything else was fine (cool interior design, clean, fast service, friendly staff, and my dish looked and tasted great), what they made for my mom was just plain wrong. It's like, are they playing a prank on us? Holler and Dash should have cut out any dish on the menu equivalent to my mom's god awful meal and keep everything else as restaurant favorites.  I suggest you only order the popular ones pictured on Yelp. That will save you money and frustration.

kFeXvJg4R4M8gOjT_WfDcQ.text: Mann, let me holla at you! This place here in one word is fantastic. It was packed because it was new, but it was well worth the wait! I love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States

fyC7RveaTr5BFi4HW7jcUw.text: This was our first time eating here. My wife got the Chicken, Set, Go and I got the Chicken Holler. Both biscuits were very good. My wife's could have used a bit more pimento cheese.  Her side was the cheese grits while I got the tater tots. Both were good. The amount of food was ample to satisfy us. We definitely plan on visiting this place again.   The way they do things is a bit different. They use enameled plates and real silverware. My wife enjoyed her coffee in a ceramic cup.   The personnel were very nice, greeting us as we entered, and helpful in helping us make our selections by explaining what each dish was and what was popular.

FsOVTYROpq4kY1L6yvahPA.text: The food was alright, but I had to wait 40 minutes for it to be finished. I'm from out of town, and they gave me a 'BOGO biscuit' chip... which is useless. If you have an ample amount of time, sure, come here.

CKGYqccF-fRYKpGvG1CSvQ.text: The only thing this place could use is MORE seats! Lol this place extremely popular and everything that I've had has been amazing! Just be careful of what time you're going, as you could be hovering for a table, unless you encounter nice people who share a huge booth with you!

pg7bxnHerYb1oPVdsRuOlg.text: This is my go-to day off guilty pleasure. I've been three times and each time the service has been consistent and the food has been great. Chicken, Set, Go is always great. I have also tried the Pig in the Garden Sandwich which was tasty, but a little hard to navigate while eating. I look forward to eating my through this menu and discovering more delicious dishes!

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States

oGU1wJQcQ34aBj-D1kNMaQ.text: So let me start in saying that I would have gone for 3.5 stars if I could.  I struggled between 3 and 4.  The food here we enjoyed.  I thought for the servings, overpriced but very tasty.  The service was pretty awful but I will give them a pass since they have not been open long.  A nice touch was the young girl standing by the door when you come in explaining how everything works and handing you a menu.  You order, get a number and sit.  My wife and I both ordered biscuit sandwiches, sides of fruit and grits for me.  Two lates and you are at $30.  The biscuits were about half the size of a place like biscuithead and pretty much the same price so prepare yourself for that.  The flavors come through though.  I had fried chicken with pickles and American cheese, wife had pork loin fried with grape jelly and onion straws.  A couple of great combos, loveddd them both, wish there was more of them!  All in all, we will be back, I'll just be prepared to overpay.

J5cALWBX1TY80WUl8uX0nw.text: Great food fast and friendly!  We are in town for a trade show and didn't want to eat in the food court.  Ventured two miles away from the convention center and found this gem.  Everything we got was hot, fresh and prepared with care.  All of the staff was friendly and the smiles were abundant.  Do yourself a favor, skip the pre-made bagels and get you a biscuit!

NBB46XVP-KzONerl1bp5LQ.text: Biscuits and gravy are amazing.  The grits bowl even better and the eddy omelet was soooo good. And yes i ordered all three of those.  Not your traditional breakfast place diner feel, and food was not traditional breakfast, but everything was amazing.

OW5zHDYOe4kwIZlWfcOydA.text: Yum yum yum!! I love this new side of Cracker Barrel.  In case you didn't know, their parent company is Cracker Barrel and I think this is a very smart business move for the comfort food chain.  I had the chicken biscuit with pimento cheese, jalapeno, and sorghum sauce.  So good I practically licked the plate.  My husband went with the grit bowl and I was hard pressed to find a favorite between the 2 dishes.  My son had the chicken biscuit and again ate every bite.  We loved the casual style of restaurant and I really like the self service coffee bar. I definitely want to go back and try some of the other signature dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Plain chicken biscuit with tots
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken biscuit with pimento cheese, jalapeno, and sorghum syrup
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States

cKK5M_bBNd4YdojdD3tUDw.text: A friend and I came here for brunch on yesterday. Nice establishment, but seating was limited during our visit due to the volume of customers. The tater tots with holler sauce was great and the grits were real creamy.

5YIY1Su_uznsj6LNzKTplw.text: I was optimistic about H&D given its relationship to Cracker Barrel, albeit for a different target audience.  At Cracker Barrel, service is always friendly and fast, food is good at a fair price, environment is family-friendly, and even if there is a wait, there at least you have a chance to look around at an assortment of items or even sit in a rocking chair and play checkers.  I found the experience at H&D to be missing on all these points.    I arrived at H&D yesterday at 11:30am (a bit late for the breakfast crowd, but early for the lunch crowd, or so I thought).  I was surprised to see the line was 20+ people deep, but I thought surely it must process quickly.  I was wrong.  It took a full 25 minutes from the time I got in line to the time I got to order, all the while just staring at the people ahead with nothing to do except wait.  At least it would have been nice to kill a bit of time studying the menu if the overhead menu screens had been easy to read, but for some reason they picked the darkest colors with near-zero luminosity; that coupled with the glare of the sunlight made them almost illegible for the entire wait in line, especially when viewed at an angle of any kind.  The only activity to pass the time while waiting in line was scanning the restaurant, trying to find a single table to open up, as most of the time there were zero open tables anywhere.    So after ordering we were given a buzzer to notify when the order was ready.  I jokingly said, "After the 25 minute wait in line, watch it be another 25 minutes to wait on the food."  Turns out I was, unfortunately, prophetic: from the time we found a table to the time the buzzer rang was 25 minutes and 56 seconds, to be precise.    To recap, from the time we entered the restaurant to the time we received any food was nearly an hour (I've been to Cracker Barrel at busy times and have been in and out in 1 hour or less...including the eating of the food).  After nearly an hour wait, I was expecting something great.  Unfortunately, that's not what I got.  The food was just ok.  I got a chicken biscuit since it seemed to be the signature item, and I frankly would have been just as satisfied (if not more so) with the same item from Chick-Fil-A.  The taste would have been just as good and at a lower cost and a wait time 90% faster.    Counting the time to eat, we were there 1.5 hours.  That includes a bit of time at the end waiting in line for a restroom because they don't have sufficient restroom facilities for the crowds (just 2 unisex rooms, for which everyone must wait in line).  Even the McDonald's next door has them beaten on restroom availability.  Life is too short to waste an hour waiting for a dining experience equal to or worse than fast food so I won't be back.  It just wasn't that good.

mLxmF-3tdvtzvpzOkCEzuA.text: Visited Holler & Dash on a Saturday, it was busy as expected being that it recently opened. Staff was nice and greeters were at the at door.  The food was great! I visited with my mom and sister and we all enjoyed our biscuits. My only complaint is that the space isn't all that big, few tables. Parking is easy to come by which is nice. Looking forward to my next biscuit!

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken. Set. Go.

jA0Fn2lqpYA-5VVwCV1eJg.text: Ate brunch on 12/26.  Chicken holler biscuit: good but not spicy at all, got the hottest which is "make em holler". Kickback chicken biscuit: good but not worth $9.50 Hollerback club biscuit: ripoff. It came with what looked like half a piece of one slice of bacon, broke in half. And two tiny thin slices of fried tomato. It was tiny toppings on a biscuit. Tots: frozen from grocery store good  Grits: good but in a tiny cup 3 juices: $7.50   Overall not worth it to me. Ask for a receipt when you go because I didn't receive one.

wPcib8aG7NPzZGoP6g9V-A.text: Hot spot for breakfast/brunch right now since it just opened a week ago. The line was out the door and we waited probably 15 minutes to place our order which isn't bad as it took less than 10 minutes to get our food. The concept is fast casual. You go to the counter and place your order and are given a number to put on the table. I ordered the biscuit with fried chicken and pimento cheese. My husband ordered the bacon egg and cheese biscuit. We both ordered the grits as our side. The grits did not disappoint. They were cheesy, had a hit of garlic and were thick. we both agreed that they were delicious!  They also offer tots as a side which seem to be pretty popular. We will definitely be back. I think next time I would like to order the beignets which come with a caramel coffee dipping sauce and are only five dollars! If you're craving sweet, they have a biscuit for you. They've got a strawberry shortcake type biscuit and also have one with Jam and Nutella. The coffee and drinks are self serve so you never have to wait for a refill. Great concept all around!!

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken.set.go without jalapeños
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bacon egg and cheese

tkzTdYHukJsMAi7f-o6Y_w.text: Loved everything about this place. Number one- my sandwich was phenomenal. I got the kickback chicken and it was honestly perfect. The tots weren't anything special but the hollerback sauce to dip them in was great and completed the side. I loved how casual the restaurant atmosphere was. Do not be intimidated by seeing a line out the door- this line is for ordering your food directly. You pay up front and they give you a number/stick thing to set on your table. Food came out super quick. Can't wait to go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kickback chicken
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States

k06x9bt_sjrZ5DrcdzcCmw.text: The chicken set go was probably top three biscuits I've eaten in my life. I'm a better human being after having consumed one of these glorious golden mounds of cosmic bliss.

8nZHZZY7hDXOIZ4m6o5C7w.text: Chicken Set Go is such a great combo of flavors. Enjoyed every bite. Was also able to sample the brussel salad, beignets, and corn salsa from my friend's plate. Good options as well.

cxhVlLM64xui6mIq8St9rw.text: Stellar brunch experience. Everything a Southend millennial could want in a biscuit house. If you're really going for it, order the Chicken Holler - fried chicken, cheddar, pickles and medium, hot or make em holler hot sauce. I ordered it "hot" and the sauce was so good I took home a bottle - or the Chicken. Set. Go - fried chicken, local pimento cheese, jalapeno, and sorghum. As far as sides go, the baby potato salad is the best, seasoned with dill and a lemon buttermilk pesto, next in line are the cheesy grits and honorable mention goes to the charred corn - super fresh and light great side for a sandwich or one of the bowls.  Hospitality is on point all the way through from greeters to the cashiers to the manager Becky, really a local shop feel.  They serve pure intentions coffee and a selection of house made juices - the Agua Fresca is SO GOOD - a strawberry pineapple and lime juice blend that's perfect for brunch.  Overall my favorite things about this place are the people that run it, Lots of organic options (they make it a point to say everything is non-GMO and their chicken is fed millet grain and water only and everything is trimmed off before they hand bread it and fry it) and the perfectly sized biscuit sandwiches - they're big but you can pick it up and eat it withoute a fork and knife and the biscuits are cut perfectly round so no crumbling happens when you eat it like a sandwich.  YUM. FUN. GREAT LOCATION. EASY PARKING. GO.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken. Set. Go. - that pimento is the star
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sides (front to back): charred corn, roasted sweet potato, and the STELLAR baby potato salad

36CzOahYthCGL6O2bECvYg.text: This place was very clean and I even stayed to watch a whole movie because I felt comfortable. The food wasn't as hot as I liked it to be, I do not like my food burning but I do like my food to be hot and it wasn't. I had the Chicken Set Go (I believe that is the name) and it was good. The jalapeno where picked and I like fresh but it's ok. The servers was friendly and the manager even came by and asked how everything was going.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States

kNogsWeh2l4tYQSd_UwQUg.text: I had a little time after an appointment and after looking on Yelp for a restaurant that was near me, Holler & Dash popped up. I am so glad that I decided to check this place out. Upon entering I was warmly greeted and shown a menu. At first I was only going to get something to go, but after having such a good first impression, I decided to eat in. I ordered a sausage egg and cheese biscuit, with a side of cheese grits. I was given a number attached to a small pole. Note: there is a tiny hole in the middle of the table where you place this number lol. I didn't know that at first. After a short wait my food arrived.  It was love at first sight and bite! You could tell this was made with love (it may not have been... but it sure tasted that way). Also, its not many times where I go to a restaurant and feel cool just by being there. I can't explain it, you'll see what I mean when you go. This place is definitely top notch and they go out of their way to make you feel welcome. I don't know how often I'll be in the area, but when I am, I'll be stopping by.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sausage, egg, and cheese with cheese grits.

PvM58mMv7z_UZC-8V8upMg.text: As a northerner, this place was a real eye opener on what southern cuisine had to offer. Who would've ever thought that jelly and goat cheese on a fried chicken biscuit would be so good? My boyfriend normally doesn't do goat cheese but he loved the sandwich!

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious!!!

n9XuFy_OUiZj_Kj_yeFerg.text: Holy biscuits. I am so disappointed I live so far from Charlotte that I can't have this every weekend! I ordered the farm fresh bowl and a biscuit with rasberry jam while my beau ordered the chicken set go and sausage egg and cheese. Everything was so delicious, I'm having a hard time finding the right words. The main feature of this place is obviously the biscuits- they are so large, fluffy, and crispy on the outside, soft and flaky on the inside. It just makes you take a second to wonder how much butter is in one biscuit, but you get over that real quick. The second thing I want to highlight is how crispy and flavorful the chicken was. It is the perfect contrast to the soft and flaky biscuit and those two ingredients alone would probably make a bomb sandwich. Lastly, I was really pleased with the jam. The color was bright and almost seemed like it was homemade- I really wouldn't be surprised if it was! I would absolutely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salad and deliciously flaky biscuits
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken set go with cheese grits

WDyLiLjbAlyRTTxmSjBtcA.text: This place was a bit busy, probably due to it being Mothers Day or simply because the food is amazing! My family enjoyed the atmosphere, selection of teas/coffee and most importantly the FOOD! This is our new breakfast/brunch spot whenever we come home to Charlotte!

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grits bowl
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kickback chicken w/side of fruit
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Roast beef w/side of tots

RENCkW6gIEEbRkF_34U21g.text: This place is awesome! Enjoyed it in Orlando and Enjoying it in Charlotte.  My son loves the grits/biscuits!  The jams are awesome as well..

Ui9cQCIWqxyU9d5raX0J-A.text: After reading all the hype on a local lifestyle & entertainment website, I finally made it over to Holler & Dash. It was a Monday morning around 11am, the restaurant was quite with only a couple of patrons seated and eating their meals. I did not review the menu prior to arriving, so it took me a couple of minutes to decide what I wanted to try. I finally settled on the Chicken Biscuit, Tot Bowl, & Beignets. I ordered with the cashier and was issued a number. A few minutes after taking my seat, my food arrived. At first glance, it didn't look very impressive except for the Beignets. Upon tasting it, thechicken was overly seasoned and very salty, the biscuit was dry, the bacon on the tots was crispy. Crispy bacon isn't normally an issue for me but this bacon was so hard I hurt my tooth and I'm lucky it didn't break! Luckily, I tried a beignet before hurting my tooth...the beignets were warm with a melt in your mouth kind of texture and that coffee dipping sauce was bomb! Although my meal was lack luster, I'd come back for the beignets and to try a latte.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States

JSxApzFgyhYyGGmWKgbezg.text: Delicious, fun, and a perfect lunch spot.  Big shoutout to their Agua Fresca (for gringos that translates to fruit water) - it was awesome and I've been craving it since I left.  My friends took me here for lunch and it was such a lovely change of scenery (lots of light, cool seating and interesting design).... plus who doesn't love a good biscuit?  The setup is easy; order up front, get a number, and wait until your food magically appears.  I got a biscuit with bacon, fried green tomatoes, a fried egg and guacamole (...and my mouth is watering as I write this review a week later thinking about it).  It wasn't so big I needed to unbutton my pants after, but it was savory and filling.  I wasn't a huge fan of the roasted corn salad... I noticed that no one at my table finished that side... I would recommend skipping that one all together, maybe try the loaded tots instead.  Overall, A++.  I can't wait to go back!

uD6H3-7vGB3U-Yq9shA-vg.text: The food was really good, the service was quick and friendly and the prices were very reasonable. A great place for people who want to go to a good breakfast/brunch place but without spending a lot of money and still get quality food and not have to have a long wait. We were really enjoying our experience and already talking about coming back again, until I started eating one of the side biscuits we got and I saw a thick, short and curly hair INSIDE the biscuit. Suddenly, all I could taste and think about was hair in my mouth. I really want to give this place a great review, however just because of my "discovery" I have a hard time ignoring it and not mentioning it in my review. I hope that I can get over this traumatic experience with holler n dash with time because I really enjoyed the food here and I do want to go back, but just not so soon.

efrtpULW02hExGr8rBOzsA.text: Delicious!!!!  The kickback chicken was amazing.  It was so filling.  Worth the money!   Employees were super nice and helpful!  Clean and relaxed atmosphere. Definitely going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States

vTqRi0LtQs4gzYP0zDvaDQ.text: Order at the counter & wait for your biscuits at a table. The goat cheese/ pepper jelly combo was delicious over fried chicken on a flaky biscuit. Also tried the pork chop/ blackberry preserve biscuit and it was great too. The breading was perfect. The lunch menu looked great too, I can't wait to go back & try it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States

BZ3BzUoV-Zz4y6WSCWougw.text: Way better than a Bojangles biscuit!! The biscuits are thick, fluffy, and big. A biscuit with jam or sausage is very filling and enough on its own for breakfast or a small lunch. I got a biscuit with the fried chicken and the batter was delicious and a thick piece of chicken breast. They also offer specialty biscuits with toppings and a variety of sides. Service is fast and casual. Would definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Biscuit with fried chicken

YxXkDDreVZETUL-fBqWGGQ.text: If you are looking for breakfast, keep going. I can't figure out why this place always seems to be busy.

KjNgxZQPfGa8ojpoEXfyng.text: Sadly the line is misleading here. The eggs look like they come straight out of the microwave and the biscuits are dry. We split the avocado smash with the pork jam biscuit. We would have been better off going to Bo. The only reason for the 2 stars is the staff. They are very friendly and accommodating.

cNm3JCK6l7QqtBgdpwNUYA.text: My fiance and I just moved here. After a weekend of hosting her family and the whirlwind of moving, this morning was the first time we got to sit down and have a nice quiet breakfast. Not knowing the area, we came to Holler and Dash after passing it a few times along the way.   All I can say is WOW. We will absolutely be back. The food was excellent and fresh (give me that Pork Rambler and tots any morning after a hard night out...) and the service was courteous and efficient. Thanks for a great intro to the Charlotte breakfast scene!

-x_lmlDmR1iu5sS1TegQgQ.text: Had high expectations for this place (based on reviews and online photos).  REALITY:  Good Coffee (no artificial sweetener available at all, I even asked), Omelet cold as hell, and NOT as pictured!  Avocado toast had a nasty tasting (what I think was) paprika on top... yuk!  They forgot my butter for my biscuit, but it wouldn't have mattered... it was STONE COLD!   Don't recommend... but truly wanted to.   Glad I'm vacationing, we have an amazing "biscuit" themed brunchery in Tampa Bay, FL... that puts this place to shame!   #Disappointed  #HollerAndDashYuk

ob4o8xOwpWra8uDDY_6GrA.text: Had a lovely brunch here on Labor Day weekend.   Given it was at the  holiday weekend, the place was packed-and to make things even worse. the kitchen was down to one oven.   Despite the unexpected complications the staff handled the situation well. The girl at the cash register, Brooke was super sweet and even took time to ensure the side salad I ordered was dairy free.  Will definitely re-visit and recommend Holler and Dash to friends.

CkI4Vicb8PF0F4Gw3YYGJQ.text: Oddly enough I haven't had a biscuit here..yet!  I came with a friend during my insane bikini competition training so my options were pretty limited.  But holler and Dash had an option for me!  I opted for the delicious "everyday Im Brusslin!'  It was delicious.  The avocado Smash toast was a hit too.  Anytime i see watermelon radish on a menu, I'm in love.  Don't be fooled by the line, it moves fast and the brief wait is worth it!  On a nice day, enjoy the outdoor seating or be quick and grab a table inside.  My friend had a biscuit and she savored every bite.  Needless to say, now that bikini prep is over, I will be coming for those biscuits!

rSfiK9i-ZX5TjqInqY5LLA.text: Great food! The biscuit was heavenly!

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Set GO! Delicious! The charred corn salad was tasty, as well as the sweet potato kale salad.
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Everyday I&#39;m Brusslin&#39;. Would have enjoyed more as a side instead of a bowl.

gW6G8eA3NlMBIfjNloslTQ.text: Good food. Love the diverse menu. Strawberry cream biscuit desert is awesome. Black berry butter jam biscuit is also good. Grits are very good. Oh an evening on my plate was delicious too.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States

NGJU8p8Y3jZbwC1Pv1smYw.text: Absolutely delicious. The biscuits were flaky, homemade, and full of simple ingredients. The fried chicken was crispy and juicy. Everything seems to be made with fresh, local ingredients, and it pays off. The service was great and attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Holler medium hot sauce. Fried chicken with hot sauce cheddar cheese with homemade pickles on top and a charred sweet potato salad
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken. Set. Go. It has pimento cheese honey and jalapeños on top with a corn salad on the side. Absolutely amazing.

rDg9BfiDShFZor7e79h1fg.text: It's as good as they claim! Literally haven't had a single bad thing here, and we have tried almost everything after coming 8 times. Insider tip: call your order in ahead of time for pick-up and beat the crowds. The way they pack the take out is ridiculously impressive.

ECeEDu65qz_N8dBAq3OOMw.text: Buttery, fluffy and slightly crispy biscuits..Yum right! Although, this isn't my everyday treat to myself my once a week visit to Holler & Dash is definitely something I look forward to. I try to order something different every time but who can deny the signature chicken.set.go is a winner! Their grits are a must. Another fav if biscuits aren't your jam  is the Hey Eddy omelet. It's very fresh and all of the ingredients come across light and delicious.  Weekday mornings are great if you want to avoid parking issues or South Blvd traffic. Or even better Postmates delivers!

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken.Set.Go biscuit with a side of cheddar grits

3H2XGLZbYKFtQBP_CTPvfQ.text: Both the biscuit and the jam had a horrible after taste. This business name should be reconsidered

LjotrY5e-A4RI7xxcIwFhA.text: I never would have guessed this was part of the Cracker Barrel family although, when I think about it, the food at CB is generally pretty good, especially at breakfast.  It's just how different the vibe is at Holler & Dash.   Certainly not country by any stretch.  Not hipster either but certainly closer to that than country IMO.  I fully enjoyed the Kickback Chicken with the pepper jelly, and goat cheese and the sausage and egg is solid as well.  These are not the greatest biscuits ever but they are good as are the fillings.  Ordering is easy and the food comes out quickly.  If you go on the weekends at peak hours you may be better off getting biscuits to go as they get real busy and sometimes folks may choose to linger in their seats long after the biscuits and coffee have been downed.  To those folks... Yes, you paid for your food but give the rest of the world a break by looking around and thinking, "Wow this place is packed, I bet someone else may enjoy sitting while they eat..."

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kickback Chicken

bJcyjdNIwcHzY5L5zhNKzw.text: My Holler & Dash experience was not great. The line to order was very long when I arrived at 11:45 am on a Sunday. The line took about 25 minutes. Once I placed my order the food did come out relatively quickly, I would say within 5 minutes. The food was okay. The side of tater tots was excellent. I also ordered a biscuit with jam; the biscuit was dry.  What bothered me the most during my visit was whenever an employee came out to the dining area to clean tables and grab the dirty dishes they would make so much noise. Like they LOUDLY banged the dishes and slammed chairs when they pushed them under the table. It seemed intentional, like they were so unhappy being at work that they wanted everyone to know it by disrupting the dining area with banging of dishes and furniture. And this happened multiple times during the hour I was there. Also while I was dining, supplies that were being stored in the ceiling above the entrance to the restrooms fell and crashed from the ceiling to the floor. It was extremely lucky that no one was there or they would have definitely been injured. The whole dining area froze when they heard the crash. I hope Holler & Dash decides not to store anything up there anymore after that.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Biscuit with blackberry jam and side of tater tots
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Social media

xvFoRtG2_GLDV75BS-khQQ.text: This place is everything I hoped it would be when I first heard about it. Specialty biscuits packed with flavor that are sure to keep you coming back. I've been here a couple times and I loved it. They give you a casual and fast way to enjoy southern breakfast delights. Mostly known as a biscuit place, this restaurant also offers sandwiches, bowls, omelette and sweet treats. I've only tried a couple of their biscuits and they are so good that it's hard to try anything else!  My favorite is the chicken.set.go. I'm pretty sure it's the delicious pimento cheese that keeps me going back! Surprisingly my favorite thing to go with it is the grits with cheese. I'm not a huge grits fan but they make it absolutely perfect here and it complements the biscuits so well. It can get pretty busy here but the lines go down quick and last time I went by the time I fixed my coffee and sat down my food arrived. This is a must try for a differ t kind of breakfast experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kickback chicken
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken.set.go

4sOkT6QcQr0CXrPjkC0CkA.text: Holler and Dash makes me want to holler at everyone who hasn't been here!   Go ahead and dash here because they have some down right good food. I have had the biscuit and Jam that was so fluffy and buttered it made me break my no carb diet with just its presences!   I got the grit bowl with bacon ,chives , fried egg and a shot of hot sauce. It was so much flavor I thought my grandmother was back there cooking in the kitchen. This food is very rich , filling and really full of flavor. I wish there was a better word to describe how my mouth felt after first contact besides me wanting to walk back up to the counter and ordering another plate to go.   I would try the chicken biscuit and grits for sure !! You can't go wrong with the size and taste here. Be prepared to wait if you go during a busy time !

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grit bowl

FZopKv0ZB9kSfwd5vEn0Kw.text: Watch out Tupleo Honey....Holler & Dash has biscuit game!   LOL, they're both great but let's give a shot out to Chicken.Set.Go with the pimento cheese and jalapenos with sorghum.  Everything looked great on the menu and Instagram really sells it with their pics. I can't wait to go back and try another menu item.  WELL DONE Holler & Dash!

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gotta have the pimento cheese for Masters Weekend! Chicken Set Go for the win!

roSh0LD9kTTXeuq67OXnAg.text: I will probably receive a chorus of BOOs from my fellow Yelpers (esp. the Millennials), but I gotta say, we didn't love this place. Yes, the biscuits are tasty, particularly, the Kickback Chicken, which has a lot going for it... I mean, come on, are you kidding me? Goat cheese and pepper jelly! I could eat an old shoe covered in that stuff!  Our side of tater tots was nothing special, just the kind of tater tots you'd find in your grocer's frozen food aisle. There are many other tasty looking alternatives though and the eggs looked great. Our cafe lattes were beautifully prepared and were delicious but were unfortunately served lukewarm (meh).  The other problems for us were simply in the details. To start with, after informing the manager that we were wrongly charged $9.50 each for our Kickback Chicken when the menu board directly above their heads clearly read $9, she offered little explanation and no concern or apology (but to be fair, she was very busy.) I had to wonder though how many other customers were overcharged that didn't notice.   Despite its 96 sanitary rating, we had to search thru four forks and three spoons before finding  clean ones without dried-on food and had to clean our own table before eating as did the couple beside us. Also, can I say, I love dreadlocks and beards (hey my own son has them) but not when they are left uncovered on someone preparing my food, and there were three such cooks in the bustling kitchen on this late Saturday morning. (I mean did I die and wake up in Asheville or something?)  Maybe I'm just too old and uptight... but I have one last gripe. I hate to pay $28 for breakfast for two and have to order at a counter then have to bus my own table, which is the case for everyone here.  In spite of all that, I'd still recommend giving it a try but not if you have to make a 25 minute drive from south Charlotte like us.  So there you go... go ahead, Boo, howl or hiss, but just please don't throw rotten fruit or veggies at me.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outside dining available.
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bustling kitchen
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kickback Chicken

xZseejeZfpbLTtlzdCRjUQ.text: Parking lot shared with Harris Teeter grocery store, lot was full at lunch time. Order at the counter and receive a pager.  Staff gladly gave samples of their sauces.  Dining area has booths and tables, prepare your own drinks/water/coffee.  It was cold raining day but also very cold while dining.  My group order a variety of ideas.  Food was cooked to order and delivered hot in temperature.  I'm not a biscuit fanatic, but the biscuits were great!  Desserts were also wonderful (beignets were a little greasy). I would definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gravy

amPdd_W26j0n81fWCTPv8g.text: Came here on a Friday morning for Breakfast.  I have been hearing good things about this place but do not find myself venturing over to South Charlotte during the morning hours.  I came here and I was warmly greeted by the staff.  I took WAY longer than usual to make my decision because the Garden Goat sounded so divine.  I ultimately ended up and ordering the KICKBACK CHICKEN biscuit with a side of cheese grits.  Thankfully they weren't terribly busy and the server had the patience of Job.  Everything was pretty much made to order and served up fresh.  I was on-the-go so I took my meal with me.    The meal was absolutely delicious.  The creaminess of the goat cheese, the crispy and well seasoned chicken breast, the sweetness and spiciness of the pepper jam and the green onions freshness married together in perfect harmony.  The biscuit was fluffy and perfectly done.  The grits had wonderful flavor but were just slightly under salted and under cooked but not inedible.    I absolutely loved this place, the speedy service, the atmosphere.  For the Southside of Charlotte there was ample parking but I could imagine that it would be at a premium on the weekends.    All-in-all a great experience.  Can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yummmy

N9YyRfb3N7JM2jpR6Aoz3A.text: I want to preface this by saying that it was stacked against them as I have clear favorite biscuit places all over North and South Carolina. However, with that said if you're making a biscuit in NC or SC then you need to bring it. They brought something good but it wasn't quite near the top for me.   First, the biscuit. Each biscuit fan has a specific type of biscuit they like, I'm sure. Mine is the fluffy, maybe messy type that feels like a big pillow of dough that has perfectly risen to meet your expectations. Flakyness is a must, but I don't want it to run so deep down into the biscuit that you're eating flake layer after flake layer without ever getting that pillowy fluff. With that said, this is a fine biscuit, but not a great one. It felt a little on the dry side to me--not a dry biscuit, but a drier biscuit than I'd like. That's especially obvious when paired with something that is crispy and fried, like fried chicken. I don't think there was nearly enough sauce or something refreshing to add moisture to the overall biscuit. I got the Kickback Chicken--which I thought would have plenty of that moisture because of the goat cheese and the jelly but it just didn't meat my expectations. The biscuit itself was also quite small. Granted, I don't eat a lot, but I've gotten top notch quality chicken biscuits for so much less (or the same price for more) that it irked me a little after the disappointing bite. My partner had the tot bowl, and that was fine as well, but as with all loaded tot dishes it's a hard balance between loading it and keeping the best thing about the tot, which is all-around crunch. Overall, it's not a bad experience, but after having to wake up early to drive my parents to the airport, I didn't find this a satisfying end to my morning.

k01SJMzwzvBhSyhKxdn1rQ.text: Love this place! It's fast, convenient and delicious. This is a perfect brunch spot that gets a huge crowd so make sure to go early.

OunFpufDOf2Tq3YxjO6Kzw.text: Met one of my buddies here for brunch while he was in town. Figured it was fast and easy to get to since it has a parking lot! The line moved rather quickly to my surprise. The signature biscuits are all unique. When you break down paying $8.50+ for a biscuit and side you really hope it's all worth while. I ordered the Pork Rambler! Fried pork tenderloin, blueberry butter and fried onion straws! THIS SAMMICH WAS EVERYTHING!   I only give it four stars because my order was forgotten and I had to track down someone to have the order made. They took care of my order but it seems to be some execution practices that need to be straightened out after an order is placed. My buddy sandwich was incorrect but he didn't mind it. Overall two thumbs up here and I would definitely come back.

BImg3HAbY9ZDSKx9Iq0MZA.text: If this is their idea of an omelette they've got it wrong. This was almost $9. Seriously?!?! The only reason they got that extra star is because they're avocado toast is decent. Super small and overpriced, but nonetheless good.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States

zzgJW28os0jzGhqS-UIgDw.text: Good Concept - Poorly Executed  A new concept from the folks at Cracker Barrel. Locally sourced, upscale comfort food in a modern environment.  Went for brunch Sunday a week ago after Church. Had tried to go twice before when they first opened but in both cases, line was around the building so go to plan B which is find another restaurant.  No line around the building but there was one when you walked in that extended well into the dining area before it made a 180 degree turn and brought you past the order desk and another 180 degree turn to place you order.  We went through this ordeal and finally placed our order and found one of the few remaining seats which was a high top next to the cattle call line.  The whole time I was there, I constantly had someone bumping into me and that was while I was trying to eat.  Concept is you order at the desk and they bring it to you. A number of locally sourced partners which of the ones I was familiar with from the Davidson Farmers Market are very good,  My wife order the Andouille Hustle which is Andouille Sausage with Gravy on an open face Biscuit. She liked which I am surprised because normally she does not like anything Cajun.  I had the Raise Up Roast Beef. Well prepared but way too salty and this is odd. I've been criticized before for salting my food first and normally a little salt is good. In this case, way to salty from the get go.  The Salad which the side was good although the spinach was not prime  Bottom line.  Food was OK but split results. Wife liked her's and I did not like mine.  Both agreed, way too noisy. Ambiance: design was good but being in a cattle chute the whole time you were trying to have as least a moderately quite is not good

HpBK8mbKQgdTSj4GKsc1Uw.text: We were very surprised that this was a fast-casual restaurant. We ordered the chicken biscuits with pimento and goat cheese and jam (I forget the names) and both were good. Overall this was a fine breakfast at a decent price.

8XPNDNBWqPFIPHXuRFN62w.text: I came to Holler & Dash at around 10 am on Labor Day, and boy it was PACKED! We waited close to 25 mins in line. I ordered an avocado toast + biscuit & jam w/ an iced Caramel Latte, and my bf ordered the Chicken Set Go.   Lived up to my expectations! I loved my biscuit & raspberry jam - too yummy! My iced latte was delicious as well - not too sweet. Avocado toast was good too, but won't be getting again (too expensive).   Definitely recommend & hope to be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Biscuit and jam - delicious  Avocado toast - bombbbb

VrUrVQmuPj2Licv-aZufFA.text: Great easy flavorful menu. I'm vegetarian and my husband is a meat eater. This was the perfect place. I had the Garden Goat Biscuit with cheddar grits. It was absolutely perfect. The goat cheese was fried just right. My husband had a bacon egg and cheese classic biscuit. He says it was spot on. My coffee was self-service for me since it was a regular coffee. This worked out great since a like my coffee vey light and sweet. We ended our breakfast with beignets. This was our first time for beignets, and they did not disappoint. All and all a great experience will most definitely come back. Oh did I mentioned, the piece was just right.

61NkEq72ZARJE2x_pj-LKQ.text: Fresh ass food. Food that is good for you.  The Brussels sprout salad was delish. Eggs with asparagus, yum. The biscuit was so damn good and the jelly made it even better. I will definitely holler and chill next time I am in town.

ea0blCJzMrkb17Kwh6ytHQ.text: If there's a breakfast place offering a chicken biscuit, I'm guaranteed to find it. Holler and Dash had me at fried chicken biscuit with Pimento cheese and it did not disappoint!   The biscuit was well made and the addition of sorghum and jalapenos kicked it to a new level. There was a nice seasoning and breading on the chicken cutlet that made it so good! My husband ordered a plain fried chicken biscuit and agreed the breading was special.  When we first entered, my eyes immediately went to the screen which displayed menu items. Unfortunately the screen only displays their most popular options and they have a paper menu in the corner that contains their full menu. I didn't realize this and ordered something different and then it was too late to change my mind. I wanted the beignets! They should communicate this clearly because as a first time visitor why would I look for a paper menu if there's a huge screen with menu items on it right there? The screen didn't say anything about it only displaying certain items.  The lattes we ordered were delicious though and so were the biscuits. I would definitely return!

dL5Px0jg-Kd6CoT_kN79QA.text: We tried this place based on the Charlotte Agenda's Top 10 Brunch places. I'm giving it three stars. First, I was thrown by the fact that after I order, I had to clean my own table (with a paper napkin) since there wasn't staff around making sure tables were properly clean. Basically, we bussed our own tables before and after we ate. And there was nothing to sanitize our eating area. The food was good, but why would I return to a place where I'm doing most of the work?
