d5JDZh5HBVPaUlnmJBM1lg.text: My niece was craving biscuits on a recent family trip, and this place didn't disappoint - totally worth the drive! The biscuits were flaky and had distinct layering, and the bowl we had was also quite tasty. I particularly loved the Nutella and jam biscuit - this isn't something you can find everywhere! The service was super friendly, and it was nice to be able to enjoy breakfast outside on the patio under a happy yellow umbrella. I would definitely return on a future trip!

Y8aiMZGJHMiKpZjrO-blLA.text: The Kickback Chicken was awesome!!! The biscuit was fluffy, the chicken and egg were topped with goat cheese and a marmalade/jam that gave the meal a perfect salty/sweet combination.  The grits were a bit underwhelming. However, overall great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kickback chicken with a side of grits

48o-SPv-y8qLgRb0-17h1Q.text: I'm writing a review about the customer service experience I had while dining at the Sedgefield location in Charlotte, NC.  The cashier did not greet us upon arrival, and when I asked her for recommendations, she did not seem interested in helping.  A gentleman was getting a soda from the machine and when the machine stopped working, he looked at an employee and asked for help.  She looked at him, raised her arms, shook her head "No" and walked away offering no assistance.  Not one employee was pleasant the entire time we were there eating. I will not be coming back to your establishment. I hope this review will push upper management to review their low performing staff and replace them.

Lc2XMHKoVwmoe3gOIIjT2Q.text: I love biscuits! I was definitely excited to try what this place had to offer, and I wasn't disappointed in my special chicken biscuit entree (Chicken.Set.Go). The fried chicken is surprisingly moist contrary to how it looks, and it was topped with jalapeno, pimento, and sorghum. First time trying sorghum, and it's like maple syrup but less sweet with a stronger flavor. My entree also came with a side, so I chose the tots, which were fresh (crunchy outter and moist inner). We also ordered the New Orleans style beignets... Which were a fail in my book, so I took off a star for being misled. As a native New Orleanian, I really couldn't tell what made it New Orleans style. The taste is different. The texture is different. The shape is different. NOLA beignets don't come with dip either. All in all, I would still recommend this place. Just stay away from the "beignets" if you want them NOLA style.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States

8fLI51uAFgObjOtSUbvalw.text: The grits bowl was EVERYTHING!!! That egg, bacon and hot sauce made it oh so good! I would definitely go back and get the bowl, but they're known for their biscuits so I'll try that next time. My friend's bowl came out cold and they happily took it back and made a fresh batch. The service was good and the place was very clean. I'll be back!

kLzZXY9Phm2mx30EjHuFvg.text: So. Many. Biscuits! This quick service breakfast spot has a variety of unique and custom breakfast sandwiches on biscuits that are to die for! I get the kickin chicken which is superb! It's only open for breakfast & lunch and is closed for dinner. They have some outdoor seating and will give your pup water if they sit outside! It's located in a perfect spot with plenty of parking at the Harris Teeter.

rkhEhN0VJaLSTTaHLRBKKQ.text: SO GOOD!!! I got the bacon egg and cheese biscuit! The biscuit was to die for (especially after the 5k I ran that morning). Granted, they were busy as all hell but that is understandable for a Saturday morning! Even though they were busy, they brought our food out very quickly AND were more than pleased to bring my friend some ketchup back to the table when she asked for it.   Will definitely be back soon!!

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States

opACFXcp3dfxhs6cfKAQMg.text: So good!!! Got the chicken biscuit with pepper jelly and a friend got the fried tomato, guacamole and bacon. Both were great. Manager brought out an extra piece of chicken to my friend afteroverhearing he thought what he ordered had chicken, which was very nice of him. The place was very clean and had outlets next to many of the tables for charging phone or working. Coffee was good too!

tW_wAhB7qkcMnewH7hnT3A.text: When one is considering breakfast there are a myriad of different directions you could go. Pancakes places, bakeries, a cafe, and so on. But when you find a place that takes everything thing in the freaking kitchen and throws it on a biscuit YOU HAVE TO GIVE THAT PLACE A SHOT.   Now a quick disclaimer, I am not a biscuit fan. They are always too dry and make me choke. They give me flashbacks to church potlucks dinner where some old lady brought ham biscuits that she froze from her wedding reception in 1925. However, my wife is a biscuit fan, and we have a hotel room with no kids for the weekend...so I chose the biscuit place. And I didn't regret it.   These are not funeral ham biscuits. Those freaking biscuits melted in my mouth. I got the chicken and bacon egg and cheese biscuit. Holy crap! Bread never tasted so good! I wish we lived closer. I would hit this place up every Saturday. The beignets were off the hook! And the coffee was amazing. The atmosphere was awesome, I wish we had eaten there, but bringing breakfast back to my wife in bed was a just a little bit better.   If you are looking for breakfast or just freaking good food...go here!

HGwg9pcYol0AuZNmVrcPCQ.text: This is NOT a drill! The Kickback Chicken was everything I didn't know I was missing. With every bite came a glimmer of pure bliss and also shear panic that I was closer to finishing this deliciousness that I didn't want to end. Be still my heart!!!!  The only way I managed through my feelings was with an order of beignets (because what else is a girl to do?!). Crispy flaky exterior with a fluffy buttery inside ever so delicately blanketed in powered sugar... oh and a side of a chocolately caramely sauce that you wish you had a bottle of to keep in your purse on your bad days.  So do yourself a favor... do yourself a "flavor" and get to this place!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kickback Chicken

oc9zSF--D97bDP7YdgSclA.text: This is a great spot. Casual and quick service restaurant with a modern touch. I had a chicken holler biscuit and it was AWESOME! Seating can definitely be tough when it's packed, but it seemed like everyone dining at the restaurant was as friendly as the staff. Great environment, great food. Will definitely be back!

A_3UhAeaHxDHfhS_Iw03Vg.text: First time today. I had the kickin  chicken sandwich. It had goat cheese sweet pepper jelly and green onions. They had me at pepper jelly! A must try. My husband had the andouille sausage and gravy over a biscuit topped with cheddar cheese  Great flavor. The only miss was the coffee  It was weak. I prefer a bolder flavor.

KaBKdZb17ZM29mCKoJYaMQ.text: Yummy! A lot of great things about this place. The employees are very friendly- greeting you as you enter. The food tastes wonderful! The chicken biscuit was so tasty and the biscuit itself was dense and didn't fall apart. I prefer this for biscuit sandwiches. It tasted really good. I had the cheddar grits and they were delicious. My only critique is it would be nice if they were in bowls - and a little larger of a side. It's in a little plastic cup which seems wasteful. Good amount of seating and lots of parking! Will be back!

bLd3uiI7_5WyvdU6VdmsFQ.text: This place was such a great find. We arrived and the place was busy!  But we were greeted as soon as we walked in and the line was moving quickly. The staff was friendly and very welcoming. We placed our order and found a seat, we were given a number. The server brought our food to the table within minutes. And everything I repeat everything was delicious. I opted for the avocado toast and tots. And everyone in my group loved there meals. The beignets are light and fluffy and the coffee sauce was amazing. I definitely recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States

zFlyI0ZOisNwzOlpgLLORQ.text: Holy moly amazing!!! I had the fried goat cheese biscuit...just say those words out loud. Fried. goat. Cheese. Biscuit. Literally the best biscuit I've ever had in my life! Cheese grits are delicious as well, wish we had one in Raleigh!!

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States

cDsNsfCM7ZUpr3BEUnFpSQ.text: First time here, food was good. Some of the menu items are a little different, but you can still get a simple breakfast sandwich or sausage and gravy biscuit. My cappuccino was good, but 2.50 for the side of fruit was a little much. 1.50, at best, guys. Overall, we enjoyed the food and will likely make a return trip.

IbjSsj6ooEv1Cl4mY_lypQ.text: I order the Kickback Chicken with a side of corn salad.   Omg. This is my first time in Charlotte (from California), first time in the south since not being a child. Now I can make my own foodie decisions on where to eat.  Not sure if this is a chain or not, had a little bit of a chainy vibe, but also reminded me of a Panera interior.   The guy at the counter was super nice and suggested I get the Kickback and I'm so glad I did. The chicken was juicy, the pepper jam was just like I expected it to be... reminded me of something from my past, just not sure, and the goat cheese & chives just did it.   The corn salad was elotesque, but cmon they threw in onions and peppers and mozze chunks with a minor squirt of lime. Yes yes yes.   They need this in California.

AC5ciukYtiDwrXQpEv4QuA.text: Recently a friend and I went here after church. We arrived around 10am and the place was buzzing but not totally full. We were asked to find a table rather easily. You order at a counter and then someone brings your order out to you. I had the chicken biscuit and added egg and cheese (+$1.50). She ordered a bacon, egg, and cheese biscuit with a side lud sweet potatoe salad. She was underwhelmed with the salad and believed the biscuit lacked some seasoning. It is filling though. We also ordered some benigets. With me being from La. I thought they were good enough to satisfy a fix but could not hold a candle to any place in New Orleans. But I wouldn't expect it to. I may come back again.

6CUwltCBTUuEA7edCbSx0Q.text: Great girl who was the one passing out menus and explained to me the menu. She was really awesome! Very busy place and loud...but great that they have great business. The food was good! I would visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States

IdwkKxWtFnhLLvDPsyTRuw.text: Just wow. I'm not sure if I was famished or if this food was just simply amazing, but I'll go with the latter. It was a Postmates kind of Sunday. I did not look at any reviews before ordering (shocking!) so I chose some basic items. I went with the chicken biscuit and grits and breakfast date got the grits bowl and biscuit with jelly.  Chicken biscuit: It is a nice serving. Almost impossible to eat without taking off of the top of the biscuit. I added an egg to. The chicken was well-seasoned (which I don't find often from these hip, trendy places). My only complaint is that I requested jelly and there wasn't any. The sandwich kind of needs something to tie everything together. Once I found some jelly, it was a win-win! Truly enjoyed it.  Cheddar grits: I couldn't believe the taste. Plain and simple, get the grits. Co-signed by a southern girl.  Overall, a really good meal! I will order again.

0Bm_vag6y0rtuBAOOYcW7w.text: Fast casual breakfast spot. Order at the counter, get a number, fill up on drinks and wait for your food. The biscuits are pretty good and the service is efficient. We got the fried green tomato biscuit and the fried chicken one. The fried chicken one was the favorite.  Update: came back and got the fried chicken biscuit with pimento cheese and it was off. Chicken was burnt, there was a teaspoon of pimento cheese, and the biscuit was super dry that I didn't even eat it. Same with everyone else's meal. It was off.

DuzSVjf2DNFmXzBKIteBbA.text: Overall okay for my first time. I picked up my order. Kickback chicken and garden goat signature biscuits. The biscuits are good, but not sturdy enough to hold everything in between. Flavor was okay. It was not out of this world. As I would say, it is not calories worthy. Beignets was soggy and greasy. I did get it to go, so it may be better if order in the restaurant. I will give it another try if I happen to be in the area.

5MYxe8AfhPEsamtz2QPejA.text: The biscuits were really good. I'm not sure that I would order the Andouille hustle again, but it was ok. There honestly wasn't much flavor in the gravy and it overwhelmed everything else. The Beignets were not actually beignets, but were fine, but they were puff pastry cut into a square and fried. For this Louisiana girl, if you are going to call something by it's name, it should at least be a close representation.  I don't remember what the BF ordered, but he enjoyed it.  The line took a little while. Finally one of the other workers came up and got frustrated with the girls just standing around and opened another register to take orders. The food didn't take long to come out. We may give it another try when we're over that way one day, but I won't go out of my way to go there.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beignets (half eaten )
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Andouille Hustle
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Order is in and we&#39;re just waiting to enjoy!

1MMH8IFHghndWnpSbQdkVA.text: This place is so good! Unique little spot in Southend -- and very trendy! If you're looking for lighter fare or a hearty meal, you can find both here! You order and then take a seat (inside or out)! Outside offers covered seating -- which is nice for hotter days in the city!   I decided to be adventurous and try the Garden Goat Biscuit, while hubby got the grit bowl and took everything except for THE egg -- I'm working on his tastebuds.  also decided to grab an iced latte and OJ.   Great food, great service!   Also, 10/10 would recommend if you've had one too many (drinks) the night before. I may or may not have been guilty of this!

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outside view!

HAKtrKIDbgvPHXECLR-xvA.text: I ordered the Hollerback Club. I wasn't impressed. Bacon, fried green tomatoes, guacamole and the sauce should have been amazing but I feel like it was missing something. The biscuit itself was super dry. I'm open to trying other biscuits but this particular one just wasn't great

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States

XEG6r9Al6lOjMjSIVS7OZw.text: Let me start by saying I did not arrive until about 40 minutes before closing so the quality might be a little better earlier.  I got the kickback chicken with the cheese grits. The biscuit was dry and hard but tasted pretty good. The chicken was also kinda dry and disappointing.    The idea of chicken, goat cheese and pepper jam is good and I have had a very similar biscuit at another biscuit restaurant, but it was executed much better.  The grits had a nice flavor but thick and pasty.  I do plan on giving them another try not so close to closing time.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kickback chicken and cheese grits

TNy5zzw-2LCILmecWvRYdA.text: I was looking for a good brunch restaurant and chose this one as they serve brunch menu every day. Ordered kickback chicken biscuit, hey eddy omelet and avocado smash toast and side salad. Overall they were okay but not great. It was mediocre brunch meals. The biscuit was just okay but the chicken was crispy and good. For the price, they are fine. This is a casual brunch restaurant you can go if you have a craving for biscuits on weekdays.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kickback chicken biscuit,hey eddy omelet, avocado toast, side salad
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Special juice

FoHRblkm-406BD-tsZPEqw.text: This place was alright. I went to grab brunch here with a couple of friends on a Sunday. It was a little crowded but not impossible to grab a table if you're willing to hover a bit.  I tried the Kickback Chicken and the Chicken. Set. Go. with a side of tater tots and sweet potato salad (sharing with a friend). I'll start with the biscuit--the biscuit is pretty solid, however, it does err on the drier side.  The Kickback Chicken sounded good in concept, but, with the jam on top, it ended up being much too sweet for me and not savory enough. The Chicken. Set. Go. was also similarly sweet but not nearly as the Kickback Chicken. Despite the jam and syrup on top, both sandwiches tasted a bit dry overall, from the biscuit and the chicken itself. The sweet potato salad (I know should be sweet) was covered in honey, lacking any tartness to balance. The tater tots could've used some more salt but generally measured up to the pleasurable taste of all tater tots.  Overall, this place was a miss for me. I do enjoy the uniqueness of the restaurant. If I ever come back, I'll probably aim for a classic biscuit instead. If you have a sweeter tooth than I am or if you're a lover of jam, this place is probably worth the try.

GqgYVyCBfETxJdFihLhbdA.text: Went here for brunch with my brother on Mother's Day. It was super crowded but yummy! I got the Kickback Chicken which has goat cheese and a sweet pepper jelly. It was delicious! I also got the cheddar grits which were pretty good but not the best I've had.   For dessert, we shared a strawberry and dash, which is whipped cream cheese, strawberries, and cream cheese on a biscuit. It was pretty good but a lot for one person. I did notice they were giving a free half of one to all the moms which was nice.   A manager came and checked on us and was very nice. My only complaint is the long line at the front. They only had one open register and I think it would have helped to have both going considering how crowded they were for the holiday.   Overall, it was pretty good and since it's close to where my brother lives, I will probably be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Strawberries and Dash
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kickback Chicken and Cheddar Grits.

6RMXAsMLrTLF9VtBke4OyA.text: Dry, bland tasting biscuits that fall apart at the slightest touch. Go to McDonald's instead.

nrmFC6o71bu9iQH0N0zOkw.text: For a biscuit house, I have to say I was a bit disappointed with the quality and taste of the biscuits. They seemed a bit dry and lacking that buttery biscuit taste I know and love. However, the fried chicken is was delicious with a great crispy texture and quality pepper and salt flavor. They also have this spicy name that was very fresh and yummy on top of the chicken. I also ordered some beignets, and was expecting something similar to those served in NOLA, however these were a bit greasy and more like a puff pastry vs. beignet in my opinion. The service is similar to a fast food restaurant, where you order at the front and go pick up your food once prepared.

ahqUkLOdDqCDoBIlwIKDFw.text: Loved the concept of this place but unfortunately the food was not well executed. I ordered the Kickback Chicken Biscuit which sounded really amazing with the goat cheese. The biscuit itself tasted good enough but the chicken was really bland. The sweet pepper jelly was also pretty tasty but was unevenly distributed and the bites without any jelly were very one-note. My biggest complaint though was that the sandwich crumbled to pieces with every bite. After like two bites I had to resort to scooping the rest of it up with a fork.

u3mEdKntIS3f8b5DYdscAg.text: 3 to 2.5 really. Very average breakfast place. The hubby got the chicken biscuit with goat cheese and I got the andouille sausage biscuit bowl.  His at least has a yummy soft biscuit. But the fried chicken was generally flavorless.  Mine was just bad. The sausage tasted like just cut up pieces of hot dog. The biscuit in my was different (not good) then the hubbys. We didn't even bother to put much of a dent in it.  We also got a cold brew coffee. I liked it more then he did but then again he did finish it so I'd say that was a success at least. Overall wouldn't say anything really stands out enuf to want to return.

H8GSVUWIYyDXzy6LSVbwDg.text: Yummy breakfasts here! The biscuits are really light and fluffy. I really enjoyed the Chicken.Set.Go - the sorghum syrup balances the the salty fried chicken and pimento cheese flavors. The jalapenos are pickled so they are not too hot. The fried chicken was perfectly juicy. Great coffee and iced tea here, too. The ambiance is fresh and open and the you gotta use the sink in the bathroom!

Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Holler back club and great coffee!

ULKB7ku5PoNkywjWIBMQOw.text: Nice breakfast.  Coffee was a bit off but the food was good.  Had the Andouille Hustle breakfast.  Enjoyed the atmosphere and the polite customer service.  It was busy but everything ran smoothly. Would return to try other items in the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Andouille Hustle biscuit breakfast

1IVBMngRXmbSfXZh8uuaBA.text: Don't let the line during the breakfast rush intimidate you. The line goes quickly and you'll likely have your order within 15 minutes even at the busiest times. If you are pressed for time, order online before heading over. I saw the long line then placed my online while I grabbed a juice from Nekter.   The biscuits are SO good. I had one with fried green tomatoes, guacamole and holler back sauce. Just an aside...the holler back sauce should be sold by the gallon. I want to find things to dip in it... Ok, back to the sandwich. The guac was perfect with cilantro and onion and the tomatoes were perfectly breaded in a cornmeal batter. It was so big that I had to fork and knife it. The tater tots were perfectly crisp and lightly salted. Try them with their hot sauce for an extra kick.   I knocked them one star because they didn't have all the ingredients to fix the biscuit that I ordered. They did call and ask what I wanted as a substitute...but when there are only a few vegetarian biscuit options on the menu, I expect them all to be available.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States

7fqfpZ59MCsEDQDMP56LDg.text: Now that all the opening hype has calmed down a little, I think I can do my review (with multiple visits and carry-out situations under my belt).  I still don't really dare to try to come here on prime-time brunch hours, but I think the fact that H&D is still around is probably a good testament on the much needed breakfast options in Southend.  They share a parking lot with the fancy Harris Teeter, so sometimes parking can be a pain.  Now that the Waterman is open along with the other businesses in the shopping area, I'm not sure how parking will be - but the parking lot always seems pretty full when I've visited.  Parking aside, when you come in, you order at the counter and you are given a pager that will buzz once the food has been prepared.  The dining room is large with booths and tables... I really like the ceramic coffee mugs (if you get a chance to dine-in) because it's "all you can drink coffee" and they also have a coke dream machine here.  A mixture of high tops, regular tables, and booths make it easy to accommodate parties... I'm not sure large parties would do well here, but I think if you got here early enough, you could push tables together.  The signage on the tables themselves read (I'm paraphrasing) "find an appropriate seat.... be a good neighbor"  which is nice because all-too-often I've seen 1 person hogging a booth while a party of six is huddled around a small circular table meant for 2 in other places  I think early on, they had wooden spoons with numbers, so I'm glad they've moved into the pager system.  There isn't anything occupying the table that holds up the spoon either.  The biscuits are what they are:  biscuits.  They definitely lean to the light and dense kind so you will fill up pretty easily here - especially with their specialty biscuits.  I'm a fan of their cheesy grits too.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. To go order sausage and egg biscuit
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. To-go order sausage biscuit
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sweet Tea and Soda

weAcYTihiClPjo4aNZmxSw.text: There isn't too much that I miss when I'm eating keto, but I will say that biscuits are one of those things. I met up with a friend here for breakfast and a chat, we had a lovely time and while the restaurant was quite full when we got our booth, it slowly managed to empty out as it moved from breakfast time into lunch time.  H&D is first-come-first-serve as far as tables go. You'll start at the register when you place your order and get a buzzer. Then find a seat, either at the larger community sharing table or one of the smaller tables/booths if you can. Now that you have a seat, get coffee and wait for your buzzer to buzz.  I chose the "Hey Eddy Omelettte" which comes with goat cheese and asparagus and heirloom tomatoes. It was definitely delicious and a good part of a meal. You'll definitely want to get a biscuit to go with it if you're eating carbs. They look awesome.  Clear your own table and you're done. I hope you've enjoyed your meal!  [Review 10227 overall, 1814 of 2018.]

YgmdThTK-puUzE4tjs4nmQ.text: Headed here on a Sunday morning around 11:30.  There was a line but it was not out of the door. Some people weren't able to find a seat immediately but I got lucky and was able to due someone leaving as I was sitting down.   I just got the regular chicken biscuit and a fruit cup on the side. Then just a regular fountain drink. My total ended up being about $10. My food came out in a dissent amount of time maybe about 10 mins. The biscuit was delicious. You could definitely tell the biscuit was homemade and the chicken had a nice crispy breading on it. I was hoping my fruit cup would have at least some grapes or strawberry or pineapple. However, it had the part of the fruit cups no one really cares for just cantaloupe and honeydew melon probably wouldn't get that as a side again.   Definitely one of the better biscuits I have had in my life. I would recommend them.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States

zKxN-tsg-vW32btiEx_0tw.text: Went to go check this place out over spring break, and can say with certainty that it won't be my last visit! Overall, I was impressed, for it being a biscuit spot. Sure, some menu items were a little pricey, but that can be said for really any place, and honestly, the biscuit was freaking good.   I ordered a simple biscuit with raspberry jam and their beignets (initially, these are what drew me in). The person who took my order was friendly and the service itself was rather efficient. The food arrived quickly, and the portions were much larger than I expected them to be. I immediately dove into the warm, flaky biscuit, that was almost a tad underdone in the middle (perfection in my book) and slathered on some raspberry jam. The jam is from a spot in Asheville, and wow, was that the perfect compliment to the doughy, buttery biscuit. I then went for the beignets, which were doused in powered sugar (maybe bordering too much) and was excited to dunk them in the chocolate coffee sauce. I have to admit, I was disappointed in the sauce, with it having almost a burnt taste, but the raspberry jam....well that was perfection on the beignets as well! It was a good, carb heavy breakfast, but an overall tasty treat, and I can't wait to come back and try some other offerings.

0Byh_tPIevYv9wAqwtXUEA.text: Holler and Dash is what I do when I get the check! The food is good, but it's essentially a chick fil a biscuit with jalepeno jelly for 2x the price.

HlNZ1RIWLiCbTdkzru73bg.text: The chicken is seasoned very well and not salty. The grits were (in my opinion) salty and too mushy.. I'm not a fan of the texture. IoSRwTWG3CtVd-RBX229pw.text: Holler and dash is a great place for breakfast. The setup is fast casual but the lines are long and tables are slim. They do an incredible job at getting people through the line quickly. Ordered the chicken set go as well as the chicken holler. Both were delicious. Chicken holler definitely took the win though. Food was great but biscuits could have been better. Coffee selection is decent. Cold brew on tap is always a plus. Highly recommended this place.

PapVN5J_wd1DfyKdo7Z4ow.text: I got the kickback chicken mainly due to the goat cheese and a side of grits.   The biscuit in its entirety was good but it was wayyy too much bread I took the bottom part of the biscuit off because it was just like whoa. The grits were good but were served in a small cup maybe 2 sizes bigger than a shot glass...aka not big enough serving.   All in all the food was good, oh and the sweet tea was the bomb yet not worth the $12 at all!!! They need to build more Biscuitvilles in Charlotte(I was shocked to see there is only one!!) so Charlotians can get much better food at a fraction of the price. No offense but there is more to life than Bojangles breakfast biscuits.

D9236ct8NNkD5fLv6gBk-Q.text: Update- Great customer service!  I went back after receiving Merideth E.'s reply to my initial review below and I got a generous portion of pickles for my biscuit and wasn't charged $1 extra.  Also I had the cheddar grits this time and they were excellent. I'll also add the personnel has been very friendly, helpful, and efficient.  This is definitely one of my new favorite breakfast spots.   Prior review: I had an egg and cheddar biscuit and asked for pickles to be added. The biscuit itself was fluffy and delicious. The egg and cheese were also very tasty and properly cooked. Instead of adding pickles to the biscuit, I was charged $1 for a side of pickles, which would have been fine if I was given a generous portion of pickles, but I only received 3 tiny pickle slices for my pickle up-charge, minus 2 stars for that.  The iced tea was also very good.

cAYiPTxiwR0MAoAjlV3oLg.text: Biscuits were on point, and the cheese grits were very good. I also enjoyed my iced coffee. Bonus star for being extra dog friendly on the patio.

qey072lpTPLzs7ds3EOvhw.text: Fantastic service, so kind. The food was really good. Like plate licking good. I also highly reccomend the Fried Green Tomatoes. I will now crave these on the daily....

fjUDnWissP6jj1j9QCpPYg.text: Awesome quality food, different menu, reasonably priced! Best cheddar grits in town, huge biscuits. The service is excellent, we literally had no complaints and will most definitely be back.

oC_pDtAi3T6wDYCtVwnTjw.text: Love the hipster atmosphere. Great place to sit and work. Food was good, but not off the charts. I'd go back!

ZIkpYMrm3rhR7puBruk-oQ.text: Oh.  Em.  Gee.  Why? Oh why... did I do this to myself?!?  I can't... I just... can't.  These biscuits are AMAZING... And there are a few vegan/veggie options that look good if it is a "vegan day."  Since this was a new place... this most def isn't a "vegan day."  I got the Garden Goat: Fried goat cheese, kale, lemon dijon vinaigrette, tomato jam.    Oh goodness, it was great.  A THICK biscuit that is oh so fluffy yet holds together the way you need a sandwich biscuit to do so.  The flavor? Buttery (yes, I know that's not vegan) and velvety and just full of some sort of awesome sauce that most restaurants would call a "proprietary blend."  The thick piece of goat cheese was fried to perfection.  I honestly looked at it and thought that it was chicken... and thought "whelp, its a chicken day..." because I wasn't going to pass up the opportunity to try this place.  Nope... Cheese!  Creamy... delicious... cheese!  Maybe it is because I only smell cheese once a week that it just seemed awesome, but this was perfect.  The golden crisp crunchy outside was the perfect entryway to the smooth-textured inside of the "patty."  The kale was a beautiful surprise with each bite.  Almost making me think that this was some sort of health-food that I was eating, but in a good way.  The staff were very helpful.  They just opened a few weeks ago and have someone at the door to greet you and guide you through the process.  IDK if that is something they just "do" or felt necessary because someone got confused and didn't know where to order.  The process is simple... walk up to the order area, place order, grab number, wait till number is called... Hard, I know.  BUT, it was amazing to see that these people take pride in helping their customers have a great experience.  Price?  What I would expect from any on-trend place with great food.  $9 for a great tasting/sized biscuit and a side.    Check.  It.  Out.

CZz0c5SRzWxkRedrllSiLQ.text: The kickin' chicken biscuit was so amazing. I really try not to eat carbs, but these carbs were totally worth it. The line was long but fast. My only complaint was that there was nowhere to stand while waiting on a to-go order. I constantly felt like I was in the way.

WBBK76ctd4J44v9FFL50sQ.text: Good but slightly over hyped. Wish they were a bit more flexible on their menu items.

GC6FPnMaTLr7O9qrywnZLA.text: Posh spot in Charlotte with a phenomenal menu. All I can say is that the Kick Back Chicken is too die for!!!

oRoB_RqtKlwX4HHVXLPxUQ.text: We went for Sunday brunch. We ordered our food to go and ended up waiting 45 minutes for our order to get lost. When we tried to ask the employees how much longer it would take the employees ignored us at the counter and had attitudes. Only one lady was taking everyone's order after the other cashier just walked away with a line out the door. The one lady at the cashier was the only employee who acknowledged us and re-entered our order. There was no organization in this restaurant during rush hour, employees were rude, and the restaurant was running out of supplies. Overall I had a terrible experience. The food we finally got was typical southern food and ended up being too salty to eat. Will not be returning to this restaurant.

Now a couple months later I think they're even worse. 15 people in the kitchen and I finally got a refund after waiting over 45 minutes for a simple Strawberry Biscuit- they still couldn't tell how much longer it'd be. They may be expensive but they are slow and the food isn't great (that from my 1st visit - never got food to taste on 2nd try).

SgzgsDuWF3B0ty9ehkst1w.text: This is just for a To-Go order. Was not happy to find the chicken in my Chicken. Set. Go lukewarm at 9:30 a.m.!?? I hope they did not give me yesterday's leftovers for the price. Also the corn salad-did not seem fresh, quite watery. The items sloppily prepared and thrown in a bag. Always will wait that extra minutes(s) for fresh food. *Shrugs* Will say the runners were very pleasant despite the ordering cashier's nonchalance. No rush to come back.

4-AKggDIYtNU7GV_q6pnyw.text: After all the promos and build up, I was beyond excited to try this place.  And it did not disappoint.  I liked that the location has a parking lot thats shared with Harris Teeter.  And they have 15 minute parking for those doing take out, which is what I did.  I was greeted as soon as i walked thru the door.  The decor and friendly staff was great.  I ordered the chicken holler with medium sauce on the side, and a side of cheesy grits.  I also ordered the chicken set go with a side of fruit for my husband.  After placing my order, they gave me a huge table number to hold.  That's probably a little overkill for to go orders as i sit with this tall table number stand.  Once they called my number, i checked to make sure everything was correct... And to my surprise they forgot to put my sauce on the side.  I have the same issue when i go to Rise, which makes me believe that it's the type of register that they are using.   Or maybe it's just a human mistake.  I sure hope that this isn't the norm.  But considering that it was only 2 other customers in the place, I'm not sure how they could have missed it.  Now, for my review of the food... the chicken holler was good, but the chicken set go was outstanding.  I almost wanted to switch biscuits with my husband.  The cheesy grits was ok.  It wasn't better than the flying biscuit or big view diner grits.  Overall, i will certainly visit this place again and probably really soon, as in next week.  :)  staff... Please don't forget my sauce when i do come back.

Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States

_HKwKXSiNsOkOMCD4Hjptg.text: We enjoyed our visit. I ordered the Chicken Set Go. It was really good. Would've like a little more pimento cheese on the biscuit itself. For a $9 biscuit I expected a little more but I'll definitely be back. Loved the environment.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Set Go

O7klhDUQbYG1EcOHVUxBHA.text: I pass by Holler & Dash almost daily on my commute and finally had a chance to stop by! This is more so a 3.5 stars since one order was full on  knock out of the park quality while the other was on the other side of the spectrum of completely lackluster. We ordered the Hey Eddy Omelette and the Kickback Chicken Biscuit with Cheese Grits. While the kickback biscuit was to die for, the omelette left so much to be desired. It almost looked like a one egg omelette? Which, why? Loved the red pepper spread on the Kickback and cheese grits were delicious!

1jra4aE70apTYxyh3LtCoA.text: One of my favorite biscuit places in Charlotte! Not only that, I have to say prob my favorite breakfast place as well. They have he best seasoned chicken I have ever had and I love the unique biscuit options that they offer. You can definitely tell they use high quality ingredients for their meals. My southern grandmother came here and it's really hard to impress her with southern cooking. She was blown away and she wants to come here every time she comes to Charlotte!

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States

r-t4Z9GWfQYeha-jBZw9Zg.text: I ordered the "Chicken. Set. Go." Fried chicken, pimento cheese, jalapeno, sorghum  I Loved what I got, chicken was delicious and the homemade jams were good, although they would be better if they were cold.   I got a side of tater tots which went well with the biscuit, I also had a bite of the grits side which was very good also. (Not sure if possible but It'd be perfect if you could get a 1/2 grits 1/2 tots as a side)  TL;DR Delicious! 100% coming back regularly

zl7axCIz1z__zl8Gt1XnTQ.text: The overall experience here was just ok.  The service was so-so, the menu is pretty limited, the atmosphere was like that of a fast food chain and the portions are small.  The main biscuits all have fried chicken which wasnt very unique.  I wasnt expecting a big piece of fried chicken with minimal other flavors on top of a basic biscuit.  I thought maybe there would be pieces of chicken with the sauce and cheese really overflowing and the biscuit big and plump but that wasnt the case.  This was like one small step up from a chick fil a sandwich.   Also, the sides are super small.  I don't know...I just wasnt that impressed.  Not enough to come back.  They could do so much more with this concept...it left much to be desired in my opinion.

W3XLrrP_tmZX2e6lK9mOlA.text: Delicious! I had the pimento chicken biscuit and could not have asked for more. Great service, delicious food! I had the beignets and wasn't a huge fan (I think they're made in a coffee sauce and I'm not a big coffee fan) but my boyfriend loved them! Can't wait to come back here.

jmSIIzvlHr7I0OvlEIku2Q.text: Very good Fast Southern food. The staff was friendly and the food tasted excellent! Their espresso drinks were great as well.

8VsADhwFuaxN0ERoZTJfyA.text: The biscuits are pretty good here it's a fast casual conceit. I ordered the fried chicken biscuit with fried green tomatoes. It was very good

CkTUxWUPCiyFWKC7mf8nBA.text: After two visits I'm a fan! It's like a fast casual restaurant where you order when you walk in and can either dine in or take it to go. My first visit I walked in and was greeted at the door by a friendly smile and a menu. The line was pretty long but could tell it was moving and plus I needed the time to decide what I was going to get since they have a lot more than just biscuits. I ordered the grit bowl to go and I'll just say it didn't make it out the parking lot it was so good.  Everything about it made a perfect combination. My second visit I was again greeted by a smile and there was no line, both visits were on a Saturday morning, but shortly after I ordered it got packed. I went for the Hollerback Club because I wanted to try a biscuit this time. But to my surprise when I ordered the cashier asked would I like it on potato bread or a bed of kale, since I just left the gym I went for the bed of kale. I love that they have healthier alternatives and it was so good. I cleaned my plate whereas I think I probably wouldn't have eaten much of the biscuit because my friend didn't really eat the biscuit just everything else. The fried green tomato and the Hollerback sauce were so good and they have really good grits.

Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken. Set. Go. with a side of cheddar grits.

jFpLTX0IeFBRQD1bK_SWeQ.text: This place was fantastic! We stopped here for family on a recent Charlotte trip and the place was buzzing. The patio was filled with patrons and even a few dogs so you know it's legit. The inside can get a bit loud, so just be mindful of that if you stop in with a crushing hangover. The food here was great! Laura and I started with an order of Beignet's for the table. They come with coffee dipping sauce that is to die for! This is for sure a must try. From there I got the chicken biscuit with a side of chimichurri mayo and holy cow this mayo is the bomb! It adds a perfect touch to the chicken and biscuit. Laura got the Avocado Smash Toast and it came out beautifully! Talk about food porn. Another of our family got the Raised Up Roast Beef which looked fantastic! I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a quick delicious meal.

bx7-8HsZx2cHnp5aDVECQQ.text: While in town came here for dinner. The drinks were good the food was good the atmosphere was upbeat and modern. There was quite a wait but well worth it. Tried the chicken strips and I highly reccomend. Also their sides were very yummy. Dont go without getting a pims cup and a punch bowl!

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Holler and dash for dinner

CehFM07fmIJPITRN_7z9Lg.text: Little on the pricier side for a biscuit. However!! The taste kinda grants such a price. The value you get on quality food is representative.  Coffe is self serve, which is kinda weird paying up front and then then you just grab a cup in the station on the side.  The biscuits are great, 3 biscuits and two drinks comes to $30.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States

C9NpMWs0HkH0NwSpDWQR3Q.text: First I want to start this off by thanking one of the best managers here in Charlotte. I rarely use yelp even if the place I go to was atrocious.   Becky has always made our experience with this place wonderful. She goes out of her to ask how we are doing and remembers everything we talk about. This means a lot in these days of scripted welcomes with fake smiles behind them.    The food here is always great but it's really the people here that bring us back. (Mmmm Garden Goat)  Again ,Thank You Becky for being who you are. Don't change and you will go far in this world.  Your loyal customers   Jon and Karen

R85ycAm9rA6Oxk-TF4FKNg.text: First time here, I ordered the Kickback Chicken Biscuit & a Charred Corn, Mozzarella & Lime salad as my side. Staff was very friendly (they clearly rate a 5 ). To bad the food I ordered did not reach the same rating level as the staff. I admit that food was tasty (if I had the option to rate it a 3.5, I would) but  definitely not 4. At $9.50 for my biscuit sandwich, I expected the "goat cheese" to be as generously applied to this item as was the "sweet pepper jelly" but sadly, it was not. Additionally, my biscuit did fall apart. The Charred Corn salad suffered a similar fate as the Kickback Chicken Biscuit sandwich whereas, it lacked sufficient "Mozzarella" (I identified 3 small cubes) as an ingredient. After the chicken, I would guess that the cheeses represented the next sufficient cost associate with these products, thus this may explain their small amounts.  Nevertheless, I will return to this establishment to try other menu items (which looked appealing) that I witnessed other patrons eating.

6yps67aRu_alnHq84fB0GQ.text: Don't order online.   What is the point of having online ordering if you have to wait longer when you get there than the people who just walked up and ordered to go?   I ordered online at 12:20.  It said pickup would be ready at 12:50 - understandable on a busy Sunday.   I came in at 12:50, was told "we are backed up on online orders."   I watched several people come in after me, order to go at the counter, wait, and then receive their food.  No online orders came through until mine, at 1:15.    Remember, I ordered at 12:20.  What's the point?   Leaving three stars because the food is excellent and the people are really friendly.  Just don't bother with the online.

YJRXNMViDvJoFkPWjmTx8A.text: First time at H&D. Had the bacon, egg and cheese biscuit. Very tasty. Coffee was very good as well. Staff friendly and service was quick.

pK0DeVBOcKulN3hwxglqOQ.text: My boyfriend and I went to Holler & Dash last weekend and were very impressed. We are vegetarian and the menu had multiple items we could choose from (we both settled on the garden goat and it was amazing). The service was fast and friendly. We can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Garden Goat with fruit

CrS6DxTuWbYBNeGXO8NROQ.text: I'm drooling just thinking about Holler & Dash's biscuits.  I admit that I went in skeptical after all of the hype leading to its opening. I sneered at the hipster decor and phrases on the wall. But let me tell you, good food is good food and this place is DELICIOUS.  Their biscuits are dense and everything that is good in the world. They are officially My Favorite Biscuit, which is saying a lot. The melted on cheese was excellent, and one biscuit w/egg and cheese left me full for a day of physical activity.  10/10 I recommend stopping by to grab a biscuit. I did go on a Friday morning and had no issue with lines/waits, but I can imagine this place gets crazy on the weekends!

D47M-bL_84eWwYy-hcOIxw.text: GIMME ALL THE BISCUITS!  I had this spot bookmarked as soon as it became a yelp listing. :D   Stopped in here about 10:30 AM on a gorgeous spring Saturday. Needless to say, there was still a decent line to order. There was an employee greeting everyone, passing out menus & providing answers to any questions. Their were two employees ringing purchases, so the line moved pretty quickly.  I got the Kickback Chicken with cheese grits as my side. I didn't wait long until the order was ready. SO delicious. The biscuit was HUGE! No worries, I was able to tackle it. The chicken was smothered in honey - which was great, so it took off the heat from the jalapenos. Pimento cheese was yummy, too. The grits were amazing - I'm just greedy & wish there was more in the cup.  Really love this spot & will definitely be back. Friendly employees, reasonable prices. Parking is my only gripe.

SqlbT1mn--_cIbbXusyyvw.text: Delicious Kickback chicken biscuit, not too heavy for this Californian like I was fearing. The goat cheese is not too bad for those of you who don't like goat cheese. It was a small amount. Shared that and the Brussels sprout bowl (basically a good sized bowl of chopped up raw Brussels and a few slices of apple and craisins ....  btw felt very healthy lolol) with hubby and it was a perfect amount of food. Glad they had that option so I could balance out the fried chicken in my health-conscious tummy :) the sides come in a tiny cup which I wouldn't have expected if I hadn't saw other people's food.  We got a side of fruit which was some melon and pineapple. Clean, cute, casual, and modern interior with plenty of seating. Plenty of parking in the lot. You go up to the counter to order and when your buzzer rings you get the food. Happy that we tried this place! It lists on Yelp as Breakfast and Brunch but the food is versatile and appropriate for lunch. If we are ever back in Charlotte would love to try the beignets!  Appreciated the very nice sized napkins and techy machine which dispensed water.   On food alone I wouldn't give 5 stars but overall they delivered!

vneVg34Z3teMtz1fMnt1Dw.text: The food came out SUPER FAST! I ordered a biscuit with  kale and fried goat cheese. My side was the sweet potato salad.  The sweet potato salad was actually pretty tasty. I think I could have it again. My biscuit was also really good. It had a lot of kale and fried goat cheese. There was so much kale, I took some off and ate it as a side lol.   The service was really good. The restaurant was really clean and I will definitely be back.

kE3rReYFKOnmGbBonUPPlA.text: I'm a huge fan of Cracker Barrel and since discovering they own this chain, I had to try it. I was not disappointed at all! Both the food and atmosphere are far more modern than the parent company. The kickback chicken biscuit was amazing! The blue coffee mugs were a nice touch as well. The counter service was quick and food was hot fresh and delicious! The price point is the only con I have. It's slightly overpriced in my opinion, but I'll certainly be back to try more things!

C56mauBmOlMDkojc-Uz6Bg.text: Delicious biscuit spot. We got the Brussel sprout dish with Cajun turkey, beignets with coffee dipping sauce, tater tot dish, and chicken and pimento cheese biscuit. Everything was so tasty. Love all the flavorful dishes they offer here. The Holler sauce that they serve is so, so scrumptious. I wanted to put it on everything!  It was very busy when we ate here. The line moves kind of slow but the staff are very friendly. The food came out super quick. Love this place. Will definitely visit again.

HMf6SFO84JcGA7wd9iVwVQ.text: Holler and Dash is quick and delicious. I haven't tried one of their biscuit sandwiches, but I hear they are very good. My go-to is the I'm Brusslin (brussel sprout salad) with a biscuit on the side. The jam they use for the biscuits is really good, so make sure to try that.  I have taken different types of people here, and everyone enjoys the food. I need to try one of their biscuit sandwiches and grits. Another visit is in my future...

zIHF90P-udDSJqO3W4ocug.text: I was visiting Charlotte for the weekend and my friend, who lives in the area, wanted to try this restaurant. When we walked in, they had menus for you to look at. You get in line and order then they bring the food to you. We all ordered our food then we got our own drinks. We sat down and waited for our food. I ordered the Hollerback Club. It was very good and big. I ate mine as a sandwich with cheesy grits and water. The only compliant I had is my table of 3 all ordered right after one another l but my friend's food came out at least 10 minutes after ours and she ordered first. We had to ask them to check on it to get it to come out. Not a huge deal but somewhat frustrating. Overall, we had a good experience and when I come back to town, I'll come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hollerback Club

X3qVZfOhCZxv-AVu-vo56A.text: These biscuits are sooo good. I got the Chicken Biscuit which doesn't come with anything on it. They do have a special sauce they'll give you for free on request which pairs nicely with it! Tator tots with cheese and bacon are yummy. Their grits are great too. Overall, I just find it a little overpriced.

q5S063WqMyPZhF3vGKCl-A.text: I'm blown away. I've not had such a flavorful biscuit served to me in AGES.   Chicken Holler (medium heat) with Roasted Sweet Potato with Apple and Almond salad.   Let's break it down:  Biscuit: not too thick or doughy, crispy exterior but buttery and juuuuust right. Bojangles watch out.   Chicken: seasoned/sauced perfectly. The sauce wasn't running off the biscuit, it just adhered to the chicken the perfect amount to where I could taste it. Amazing. Great texture and flavor here.   Toppings: I had pickles adorning my biscuit with a slice of cheddar. Sounds average, right? Wrong. The pairing is what you'd called perfection. The spicy chicken paired with the fresh and sweet pickles was such a beautifully paired combination. The cheese was the perfect thickness, too. Married together, it was happily ever after in my mouth.   Side: I looked at the side, and I said to myself "looks good enough, let's try it." It. Was. Delectable. The combination of flavors that I would have never expected were tantalizing my tastebuds! Apples, butternut squash, kale and whatever vinegar that it was mixed with had me wishing that it would never end!   All I know is that I'm looking at my schedule for the next time that I can get myself eating here again. If teleportation was a thing, you know I would already be eating Holler and Dash!   Side note: the name of this place is genius. I'm hollering that it's good, and I'm dashing back as soon as possible. Who knows the real meaning behind the name....but I know what it means to me!

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States

APXXMcr8BEutxhfJ8Ye1bg.text: What a great start to my boyfriend's staycation birthday weekend in Charlotte!  He wanted a restaurant that served biscuits and gravy and found this place. When you arrive, it kind of gives you Noodles and Company vibes. Their menu has everything from biscuit dishes and sandwiches to omelettes and coffee. And for those that prefer, they even have almond milk (for your creamer alternative)!  My boyfriend got his biscuits and gravy with a side of fried chicken tossed in their Holler Back hot sauce, with a Nitro Cold Brew for his drink. I got the Kickback Chicken biscuit dish, with a vanilla latte (w/ almond milk). I've included the photos of the food below.  We both really loved our food and the drinks as well. The chicken didn't have too much fried bits and didn't overpower the chicken. The biscuits were huge and fluffy and definitely filled us up fast. The Holler Back hot sauce was delicious, but nothing we haven't tasted before. My dish came with goat cheese, and I didn't hate it. The cheddar grits was my FAVORITE part of my food. They were super flavorful and they gave the right portion size. For both of our dishes they were the perfect portion size and we didn't feel like we overate or wasted any food.  The only reason I didn't give this place 5 starts is because it wasn't a particularly "special" or "out of this world" place, with the Holler Back hot sauce or the quality of the food. But it was still delicious!  For the breakfast lovers out there, I highly recommend this place!

hlYJaOH0fNnz9R3oR9KLRg.text: I got the Garden Goat. It was very tasty but hard to maneuver to my mouth! The biscuits that the cheese and OMG lemon flavored kale were in were so plump that I could not eat the sandwich without making a mess, even with a fork and knife. Oh, well!

mCV1dds8XIhi613Z9fIoiw.text: So this place is definitely everything I've heard. I can certainly see why it has all these high ratings. I want to give it a 5 but unfortunately my signature biscuit today was a 4. It certainly wasn't bad at all. It just didn't meet my expectations based on the ingredients and what I saw on the menu.  Speaking of the menu, it's great! I love simple menus. Even more so, I love simple menus with a lot options and creative and eclectic food choices. Right off the bat when walked in I saw several similarities to Rise biscuits and bakery but I was immediately way more excited about their menu.  Their specialty is biscuits so the obviously have a lot of buscuit options. When it comes to biscuit options I would say they have three different types. 1. The simple type: A biscuit with jam, jelly, etc. 2. The breakfast type: A buscuit with eggs, cheese and your choice of meat and 3. The signature type: This is where it gets exciting and interesting. These options have better meat choices like fried chicken, pork tenderloin, fancier cheeses, etc. as well as some unique accompaniments.   I got the kickback chicken which has Fried chicken, goat cheese, green onion, and sweet pepper jelly. It was preety good but not as mind-blowing as it sounds on paper hence the aforementioned 4 rating. I am excited to go back and try the pork tenderloin biscuit however. It's called the pork Rambler and it has Fried pork tenderloin, blackberry butter, and fried onion. straws. They also have great sides and I got the charred corn, mozzarella and lime salad however the biscuit sandwiches are so huge that I didn't even need it.  All in all, a lot of great menu options so I'm excited to go back and try them again for brunch. Maybe next time they'll get a 5!

nuCDVzOI2T66bYH4ohhocg.text: First time here.  The line was literally out the door!  The cashiers and ordering station are immediately at the entrance which creates a bit of a cluster when its as busy as this morning was...  Orders were a bit delayed and some were a bit confused for dine in orders, but thats to be expected with the volume of customers...Seating was a hot commodity!  lol  I ordered the Grit Bowl, Strawberry and Dash and Iced Cappuccino ... It took a while to get my coffee, other than that I was thrilled with my meal!... I will have to return when maybe its not as crowded, but this place is a great spot for breakfast/brunch!

lKzXxw5Mbzj-ogK1to2aLQ.text: Wow, this place was so perfect. We came here for breakfast and to get some work done while in town and it was the best decision we could have made. I ordered the avocado toast and a biscuit and jam and my boyfriend ordered the hollerback club. Everything was SO delicious and filling. Prices were very reasonable, too! And the staff were attentive and caring, making sure we had everything we needed. My boyfriend also got the cold brew on nitro which was like any coffee we have had before- so smooth and tasty. I ordered a hot coffee which is self serve which I loved because you can make it how you want and have free refills. They also have almond milk! Would definitely go back here again, hands down!

1TgmHbxR8xdvjCBBLlED6w.text: We tried two of the biscuits, the bacon, egg and cheese and the chicken biscuit. We liked how quick the biscuits came out and how friendly the staff was, especially since it was our first time. After looking at the other pictures on Yelp, I wish we would've tried some of the other specialty biscuits, but we liked the ones we got!

sxGLoS9CFf0f6vb75lGD5A.text: I had a egg and cheese biscuit with mustard and pickles. The biscuit was flavorful and had good texture. The egg was cooked properly and there was a good amount of tasty cheddar cheese that was good and melted on. The side of fruit I had was bad though. It was a very small cup of cut cantaloupe, honey dew and pineapples. The fruit was pretty much flavorless.  Avoid getting this side, it's overpriced and not good.

j0wk9yl2NTm8J2VPaxf4yQ.text: Great start to the day! Place is clean and touch above others on level of service and quality!

9n8ecAQ0FrMETQ6pgupCpg.text: I've been wanting to try this place out so when I had the opportunity to have a brunch date here I couldn't say no! I love spicy food so I ordered the Kickback chicken. This has fried chicken, goat cheese, green onion, and sweet pepper jelly "with a kick". I loved everything about this. The flavor combos were fantastic and the portion sizes we're generous (I'm shocked). I want to come back and try their other dishes soon!

VZsU4sJCUzsyoTUXafmW9Q.text: My husband and I finally were able to check out Holler and Dash this Sunday around 12ish. I definitely get the hype....the food is delish!  We walked in and it was slammed. There were no tables so we decided to put in an online order and go grocery shopping while it was being made.  I will say, the online order pickup process is super confusing and I really think there needs to be more clarification. We were not the only ones confused. There isnt any information inside about where pickups are actually pickup'ed. Since it was so busy, we stood around for a while trying to figure out what was going on. Finally, I just grabbed someone to ask. I think our order got a bit lost in the system but one of the waitresses figured it out and pushed the order through the line. This whole process was really my only negative of this place.  When we got home, the food was still hot and we dug in. We got the Kickback Chicken sandwich with corn and tots. The sandwich was big enough for me and my hubby to split and was sooooooo good. The goat cheese on it was so flavorful. The chicken was a nice size for the biscuit. The corn was really tasty and lots of flavors. I didn't really love the tots....seemed pretty average tots. I thought they were supposed to come with a sauce but they came with ketchup, so not as fun. The tots also were all stuck together and just crumbled. Probs won't order tots next time. I have my eyes on the grits anyways!   We absolutely will return!

OHtZqWWbGCt1t8DVyZ2oQQ.text: I went here with a friend for brunch and the food was really good! I had the "Grit Bowl" and my friend had a biscuit, tots, and cheese grits"  all of the food was delicious! The line is constantly moving so have your order ready! The seating is limited so plan to hover over tables until one becomes available, sit outside, or take it to go! I would go again I just wish there was more seating!

Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheese grits, tots m, and biscuit  Fruit infused water

b7MUiM-j7fvSWlQmdYaobg.text: First found this place in Nashville and was so excited when it finally came to Charlotte. Five stars for the food for sure! The andouille sausage is delicious, and we love to supplement with some beignets. I have had a couple visits with particularly bad or rude service, but I do love the food and will continue to come back. It can be somewhat disappointing though.

hoHLq2Au8rxhuSS0xV89eA.text: After hearing the hype and looking at the menu, I finally took the plunge and went.  I selected two of the most popular signature biscuits:  Kickback Chicken - The chicken was crispy, the goat cheese gave it a tangy flavor, the green onion gave it a leafy texture,  and the sweet pepper jelly gave it the spicy sweetness that help type it all together.  Chicken. Set. Go. - Crispy chicken, cheesy pimento, spicy jalapeno, and the sorghum gave a slight sweetness.  The only down side is that there was too much biscuit.  I had to remove some of the layers to get the biscuit to fit in my mouth.  Overall, I would highly recommend going: The customer service was quick and pleasant.  The food was tasty and who does not love tater tot?

photos.caption: Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kickback Chicken
Photo of Holler & Dash Biscuit House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken. Set. Go.

EE-uUMs5FOnFLl0NUoIRow.text: Not sure what all the hype about this place is...I don't get it. Placed my order online to avoid the prolonged wait that I've heard so much about. I was given a pick up time and went in about 5min after quoted time...the place was busy there was a line...but there was no indication as to where to pick up online orders...when I asked one of the workers she responded rather curtly "If its ready it'll be right there" she explained as she just nodded to a small counter area. As I was waiting I noticed a severe lack of front of house management...there was one person working the register and one girl "running" food to the tables. The kitchen looked like it was staffed by a small army of cooks and people assembling the food.  After about a 10min wait...which wasn't too bad I got my food....I ordered the Chicken Hollar,medium with a side of the roasted corn salad...while the chicken was cooked very well and was juicy it was just your basic buffalo chicken sandwich on a  biscuit and I would avoid the corn salad...no flavor or seasoning whatsoever. I also ordered a basic sausage,egg and cheese biscuit..the egg was fried beyond recognition and the sausage seemed to be cooked even twice as long.  All in all I would not go out of my way to eat here again....and I think I'll just stick to Bo Jangles for my biscuit fix.

zbEW5DaLcRhB3tHdm5XqWg.text: Eh.... i was hoping for more.    This place is a major gut buster.  I'd go here regularly if I were trying to get achieve sumo level obesity.    While heavy, I didn't find the flavor was good enough to justify the calories.    I mean, it's not bad.  Just not for me I guess as H&D has plenty of great reviews.

PY0QxNuPnBK7LjtsuhLnzA.text: It was so delicious!!! Love their biscuits with gravy and grits and expect fruits parfait so delicious!!! Yummy!! My daughter and I come afternoon 2ish and it was not that busy! But quickly!! Good!! We will come back with our family!

VfCgayrFHJB65jvZLOiE4A.text: Good food and quick service in a nice casual setting!  Came in on a Sunday and while it looked packed it didn't take very long to go through the line. Would definitely be back.

h1Mt8czdGk8tsZzPtqemzw.text: This place is very good. I had the bacon, egg, and cheese biscuit sandwhich and it didnt disappoint. The beignets with the chocolate coffee cream sauce is really good. I would advise that you do not get the parfait as it is not good and not worth the price.

RpcAdeVmmtfWX5CeQZ0HBw.text: Thought the biscuit was ok. A bit dry in my opinion. I really needed some jelly but couldn't find any. Cute place, friendly staff.  No wait midweek. I might try again but not going to go out of my way.

gFh2oZr-JIof42rLcjZw5Q.text: First time was ok. Second time, service was terrible, took forever. Coffee was just ok and omelet was cold!  Overpriced!

XIAyB_PTJprfF0cU8uUimg.text: Simply amazing food, was traveling home from Florida and discovered this gem everyone should try

jw6mWMWp1xDkbSZKnXcsxA.text: Yoooooooooo this food is so good, it'll have you swearing off other chain chicken biscuit combos for good! The combination of flavor that you get here has an upscale feel, however it's paired with reasonable pricing and a cozy atmosphere. We shared three different biscuits and loved them all.The coffee was fantastic and while I'm sure the tea is delicious, it was the perfect pairing with the breakfast food we got. Can't wait to go back with my eating pants on for some more yummy food.

4vCEFyboQLkbCjKQ4DanIg.text: Awesome fast food, chicken holler was great! Nice spice (got the "make 'em holler) and chicken was moist. Nice casual brunch option.

uEYfLIiVwxSOddnFvYsU8A.text: I don't have any ideas why Dash Biscuits house has so many good reviews. I went here and got very bad experience. worst customer service I ever had my life.

4vKNcZB8R_Nx2ooHB8uwag.text: Great lunch spot!! Holler and Dash has only been open a week, but my friend and I decided to check it out after we kept drooling over their Instagram photos. Definitely worth it and up to all expectations! The corn salsa (side item) was refreshingly delicious and the turkey sandwich was great.  Service was also great!

1R8hYkXFl3dLcEc5ZxhkPA.text: So yummy! Everything there is sooooo delicious. It comes out fast and the employees are so polite!

OkeYaUc1z_m0YL9Zo0B6gw.text: I went to the soft opening this afternoon, and was incredibly impressed with the food and the friendly staff! The menu has something for everyone. I had the Fresh Farm Bowl, and added a piece of fried chicken. Don't forget to try a dessert...you won't regret it!!! This will certainly become a South End staple. I can't wait to go back.

rx67yshehL7Ve_FAaaY3QQ.text: So glad we found this place on Yelp. We were looking for a quick and tasty bite to eat and stumbled across this place last weekend.  I can see why the reviews are great.  1) The service and staff are amazing.  We were greeted at the door, offered menu suggestions, and the service was fast and friendly. 2) the food was delicious! I had a chicken biscuit and oat bowl. My husband had a chicken biscuit and grit bowl, and our 4 year old had a chicken biscuit.  We all truly enjoyed our meals. Everything was seasoned right, cooked to perfection, and left us feeling beyond satisfied.  We will be sure to visit again the next time we're in Charlotte.

tOSQB6Egu3TJR2to3ZU8iQ.text: This place is probably pretty smart to open in Charlotte since Charlotte loves to support its corporate franchises. This is just a not as good knock-off of Biscuit Head in Asheville/Greenville- but owned by Cracker Barrel. Maybe I am biased, but I just would rather give my money to a family owned restaurant instead of Cracker Barrel. I think Cracker Barrel is doing just fine and doesn't need to make more money. I am sure the chefs are fine here, but I wish they had just made their own restaurant instead of doing it this route.

0ZYzu0DobxOpuDs7EQsUOA.text: Oh man!  This place is like Tupelo Honey without the pretension and the payday loan. Great, interesting, biscuit sandwiches. The sauce for beignets is incredible. Plus, for a fast-ish food place, the coffee is awesome. Even if there's a line, it's only a short wait and well worth it.

MyHoxT7fW7RrpvVLt6TOMQ.text: One of my favorite places to go right now. The Beignets are to DIE FOR! The set up is awesome, has wifi, and the every biscuit sandwich i have eaten is incredible!

jITYAnWZiPViaq-xwT6Rdg.text: Biscuits are great! Atmosphere is nice as well. A hipster biscuit place is definitely a new concept to me...but if I had to describe it that's what it is!

fCDVt1XsdE1MpGIsHHyCMA.text: This place is the devil! The biscuits are SO good! I'm obsessed with the Kickback chicken biscuit - oh Lordy! Their cheesy grits are also super great. You will not be disappointed!

cuQXem4niwnCYd6v098YUw.text: Great biscuits and friendly staff!!! They are normally really busy but you can get thru the line fast and food comes out really fast as well. My 2 year old loves biscuits and gravy and I normally make them at home from scratch but these she lives as well!!! I also love the grit bowl and the avocado smash toast...

speYu4S2nGgCAE9n0-sHow.text: Soooo good ! Avocado toast the tots ask for the sauce for the tots it's delicious and my fiance has the turkey club and loved it

LTsb0MkwRil7p3CPCVLwiw.text: I had been dying to try this restaurant since it opened, and finally decided to check it out for Sunday morning brunch. It was extremely crowded, there were no tables, and the line took forever. But, okay, that's fine, I'm a patient person. I was ordering for three people- I got two biscuits- add fried eggs for $1 each, a fancy drink for me, and oatmeal plus a biscuit with jam for my husband. So we finally get to sit down and the waitress comes out and says they are out of oatmeal and asked my husband to pick something else. He gets grits and they came out first. We wait a bit and our biscuit sandwiches come out but no biscuit for him. The guy asks if we have everything and we let him know the biscuit is missing. He says he'll go get one but then he never came back. I start to eat and realize there's no egg on my sandwich. My mom says she didn't get her egg either. So we grab the waitress and tell her we still don't have my husband's biscuit and neither of us got eggs. I say it's no big deal, just bring the biscuit and can I just get my money back for the eggs. She goes "it's only $2 dollars plus tax. Do you really care about getting $2 back?"  Ummm, yes, I do. I say that I would like my $2 back, it may only be $2 but I paid for something I didn't get. She says "I don't think $2 is a big deal but I can get it for you, it's fine." Hello, Rude. So she walks away and at this point I realize I'm thirsty- I never got my drink!" So I just go inside and say I never got my drink. The cashier tells me I should have gotten it when I ordered. Okay, well I didn't, no one offered it to me or told me I needed to wait for it. So I FINALLY get my drink and I asked her for my money for the eggs, and I see the waitress coming out of the back with my husband's biscuit. She asked me to take it to him, lol. The service was terrible but the food was pretty good. I doubt I'll be back, though.

rwFIRDSgV_cWyGnzuxL4Bw.text: We checked out Holler & Dash for their opening and it was great. Their food, service and restaurant were all top notch. I will definitely eat there on a regular basis.

p437Zj72CEj45U802s0XpQ.text: The women who work here are hilarious and so kind.  First time coming in and they had great recommendations.  The good comes out quickly and huge portions.  We got a side of fried green tomatoes and they were really good as well.  The chicken was cooked well on the biscuits and not dry.  Will definitely be returning. :). Side note: they have Fresca they make there and it's really good!

tu7Pdrlr3RAcaWL9Yhz5og.text: The biscuit was delicious. However, the fried chicken was mediocre, and everything was a little bit too expensive for the amount of food. The side of fruit was measly.

VkagFYXRrtXzCHT__r5kHg.text: Best fried chicken ever, my husband is going to fly back to get more. All food was great and drinks were perfect. Great, personal service and homey feel

-rvXGSOessKOZl_R9cfGTw.text: I'm not a biscuit guy typically but the chicken and goat cheese flavor makes up for it!

UbJAUz8Kd7N8pt4hwpHRAw.text: Excellent food.  We found this restaurant with a simple google search.  As we drove through town we were skeptical about how the restaurant would be.  As we pulled up, we saw a very trendy-looking restaurant.  The first thing I noticed was cold brew coffee taps.  The next thing I noticed was the huge crowd in the restaurant.  Once we ordered our food, we were not disappointed.  The food was delicious.

wLccKYFIVma6hQubJvXLCw.text: Well i have been here 3 times in total. Each time the cust service is worse and worse.  The employee that took my order was to busy listening to coworkers client ordering than to mine. Repeated myself several times. Also I have never been to a place where when you are paying almost 4 dollars for a plain bacon biscuit you cannot ask for the bacon to be crispy. Also as she finalized my order and asked me if I wanted to receipt I said yes she didn't even say thank you nor employee that brought out my bag with food  Which b0tw I'm going to have to go home and throw the bacon in the microwave to be able to eat I doubt I will be back here again

1xcMi0lBvw6at3JPRAgfrw.text: Ran out of biscuits on 4th of July. How does a biscuit place run out of biscuits?  Does Bojangles ever run out of biscuits?  Of course not. Cant imagine how poorly run this place must be to run out of biscuits. No apologies from manager. Just cashiers saying they cant believe it either. Wont take any orders either. After 30 minutes waiting they come out and say not taking any orders until they get caught up. Not even non biscuit items. Crazy.

5s9MjMzctQdc_3eNnwAIQQ.text: I tried to order the Garden Goat but wanted to substitute the goat cheese for a different cheese because I don't like goat cheese. The cashier said I couldn't because the fried goat cheese medallion is considered the protein on that signature biscuit. She then suggested the Hollerback Club without bacon (I'm vegetarian) but I noticed that signature biscuit didn't include a cheese so I asked if I could substitute the bacon for a slice of cheddar cheese. The cashier once again said no. When I told her never mind I'll just go somewhere else to eat, she said she could make the substitution this one time for me but they don't typically do it...but I had already had enough, it's disappointing how un-accommodating and difficult they were to me for simple requests. A slice of cheese would cost them less than bacon. Sigh.

P1lN7x9yesnsJrZ7czs41w.text: Obsessed with this place! The kickback chicken was so good we went back two times in the week  also their homemade jam is seriously underrated. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu, this place is a must try!!!

J4ZzaPQd6HXj7iB-pxwS4g.text: First time at Holler & Dash and we really enjoyed our breakfast.  They have almond milk for those looking for a dairy substitute with their coffee. Lots of vegetarian options but a little thin on vegan options.  That said, I thoroughly enjoyed my avocado toast with the watermelon radish.  We also tried the tot bowl and beignets.  I wish they had a grits option without cheese (I really wanted grits) but was happy with what I got.  I definitely want to try the Brussels sprouts when we come again.

ftJbFepMilzuQLejpP8wpw.text: Ate here when it first opened and it was soooo good!  Kickback chicken and chicken.set.go were delicious.  It was packed but service wasn't too bad for being new.  On my second visit, it wasn't quite as great.  I ordered the Raise up roast beef, which was ok.  I think it was the sauce on it that made it SUPER salty.  The agua fresca was a good choice though!  The wait staff also seemed to be loud and rude to customers this day.  Also ended up sitting by the bathroom, only seat open.  The employees rudely had to crawl into the attic in the doorway there to retrieve additional supplies and proceeded to throw items down.  Luckily we didn't get hit.  I will be ordering to go or the patio from now on to not deal with the craziness inside the restaurant.

_QHqS5dAshN8BhX4IiuTQA.text: Excellent!  A terrific place for a quick breakfast that's flavorful and high quality.

RLLnxd9PiwenC7Wi5WM7AQ.text: First visit. Super nice staff. Both had bacon, egg, and cheese biscuit. Excellent taste. This is not health food, but gooooood....

pB1KmYbc3FjS2r0f25EPDg.text: Been here twice- Food and service were great both times! Recommend the Kickback chicken biscuit!!!

Eh-WMgdWscbfPvbVMbMGRw.text: Staff was very friendly. Food was awesome. I had the tot bowl with a side of fried chicken and an aqua fresca. I meant to take a picture but before I knew it, my plate was empty! Definitely coming back.
